Row.Cell: Besides the Germans, Goatskin also robbed a scholar from Prague. Jan Schindel, he's called.
除了德国人，山羊皮还抢劫了一个叫扬·辛德尔的布拉格学者。
No, not moonshine! It's a protection against magic!
不，不是私酒！这是抵御魔法的屏障！
They slaughtered some knight and his company yesterday down by the pond.
他们昨天在池塘边痛宰了一个骑士和他的扈从。
My name is Henry. And you could say I'm in the service of Sir Radzig Kobyla… of Skalitz.
我叫亨利。我为斯卡里茨......的拉德季·科比拉爵士效力。
Alright, Sir Jan, I'll help you.
好的，扬爵士，我会帮助你。
Great. I see ou're kitted out pretty well alright. Have you ever been in battle with that lord of yours, Henry… of Skalitz?
很好。我看你装备得很好。你有没有和你的那位领主一起战斗过……斯卡里茨的亨利？
你们人都他妈上哪去了？！
I can't take him on my own! Hurry up!
我打不过他！快来搭把手啊！
Here, for fuck's sake! They're coming after us!
我在这边，老天啊！他们已经杀到眼前了！
Don't just stand there! Come on!
傻愣着干什么呢！快过来啊！
If they tried to swim across the pond, they'll be found half-dead somewhere on the bank, not here.
他们要真游过了那池塘，肯是半死不活地躺在岸边呢，跑不到这儿。
If they didn't succeed in swimming to the other side of the pond, I want to know.
探清楚他们是否游到了池塘的另一边。
And what do you have in mind? Brocade and satin? A monk's robe? Or perhaps Sir Brunswick's armour?
你想买什么？绸缎？僧袍？还是布伦瑞克的护甲？
And then you ended up like a couple of filthy louts in the pillory. Don't get me wrong, but no one round here's going to believe you're a knight.
然后你俩就像一对臭流氓一样戴上了颈手枷？别误会，但这里没人会相信你是骑士。
Excellent! I was starting to worry this day would be a bore.
太好了！我还担心今天会很无聊呢。
There'll be none of that! With that brand on your neck, I suggest you move along!
别想了！看看你脖子上的烙印，我建议你还是赶紧走吧！
Of course. Wise is the man that cares for his appearance.
没问题，注重外表是很明智的。
Of course, I'd be happy to serve you.
没问题，我很乐意为你效劳。
My work is done, and you look good enough to be painted on an altar.
完成了，你现在看起来就像祭坛上的画里走出来的一样。
You're right, a haircut won't fix what your mother gave you. So why waste the coin, eh?
你说得对，发型可没法改变你天生的模样。那何必浪费钱呢？
Hah! Now you're sure to turn some girls' heads!
哈哈！现在你肯定能吸引不少姑娘的目光！
Fine, then. If my craft isn't up to your standards, feel free to go somewhere else.
行啊，如果我的手艺不合你的意，那你就去别处吧。
Next time, find a puddle to check yourself out in, will you?
下次找个水坑先照照自己，好吗？
At least a few. And if not, I don't do refunds.
至少能吸引几个吧。如果没有，我可不退钱。
Oh, come on, it was funny!
Come back any time, I can do all sorts of styles.
随时再来，我可以给你打造各种风格的发型。
I like how this turned out, and I hope you feel the same.
我很满意这个成果，希望你也一样。
That was a close shave, wasn't it?
Happy to be of service, come back any time you'd like!
很高兴为你服务，随时欢迎再来！
If you can't appreciate my art, that's your problem.
如果你不懂欣赏我的艺术，那只能说明你有问题。
Aye, I've heard that all before. It turns out a man's word doesn't mean much these days.
哎，这种保证我听得太多了。事实证明，现在人的保证都不值钱。
I'm afraid you'll have to pay me up front.
These razors can do more than just shave, if it comes to it.
如果有必要，这些剃刀可不止能刮胡子。
I'm afraid not. Bring me some coin, then I'll be happy to serve you.
恐怕不行，等有钱了再来吧，我会很高兴为你效劳的。
Either you misheard me or I forgot to tell you, but I don't serve criminals.
要么你听错了，要么是我忘了告诉你，我不为罪犯服务。
Get your things ready, I need a trim!
准备好你的工具吧，我需要修剪一下！
I could use a trim, master barber.
请帮我修剪一下，理发师。
Thanks, but I'd rather get my clothes honestly. I just got out of the pillory, I don't want to end up there again.
谢谢，但我还是宁愿诚实的穿衣服。我刚从颈手枷上下来，可不想再回去。
I'm in need of your services, master barber.
我需要你的服务，理发师。
I seem to have… misplaced my coinpurse. But perhaps we could work something out?
我好像……把钱袋弄丢了。但我们也许可以商量个解决办法？
If you give me a trim on credit, I promise I'll pay you back soon. You have my word.
如果你能先赊账帮我修剪，我保证很快就把钱还你。我说话算话。
A trim and a shave, please.
请帮我剪个发，刮个胡子。
A cut and a shave, please.
请帮我剪个发，刮个胡子。
These chave ain't got nothing on that grasnyi over there...
这些家伙选那匹母马有点水平…
But Chertan was poisoned by Bane potion, wasn't he?
但赫尔坦中的是祸根毒药的毒，不是吗？
But Chertan was poisoned with Bane. Or did I get it wrong?
但赫尔坦是中了祸根的毒，还是说我记错了？
But wasn't Chertan poisoned with Dollmaker potion?
但赫尔坦中的不是玩偶毒药的毒吗？
Phew, doing God's work sure ain't easy.
吁。为上帝做工可真不容易。
I said I'd do it, and Henry of Skalitz won't be running away from any more fights.
我说过我会做的，斯卡里茨的亨利不会再逃避任何决斗。
That's valerian, I believe. It helps relieve pain, but it's also used to make Dollmaker potion.
我想那是缬草。它可以缓解疼痛，但也可以用来制作玩偶毒药。
That bastard had the same map on him like the one I bought from Krizhan!
那个杂碎身上的地图和我从克日然手里买来的一模一样！
Krizhan has some explaining to do!
This is going to be a proper punch-up!
这可是一场真正的硬仗！
Gott sei mit mir. （上帝与我同在）
Jetzt wird dir der Arsch versohlt!
Jetzt wird dir der Arsch versohlt! （轮到我打爆你了！）
Spielt nicht mit uns! （别瞧不起我们！）
Now you get your arse kicked!
等着被揍到屁滚尿流吧！
Wir schlagen dir die Fresse ein!
Wir schlagen dir die Fresse ein! （看我打爆你！）
If you've come from them foreign nomads, get lost right now!
如果你是他们那群外来游牧民的人，就快滚！
And how much of them elderberry leaves should I put in?
我应该装多少接骨木莓叶进去？
My dear, if we could dye wool as black as night with elderberry leaves, we wouldn't be sitting here in this place. We'd long since have our own dying shop in Jitchine.
天哪，如果我们能用接骨木莓叶把羊毛染得像夜里一样黑，我们就不会坐在这里了。我们早就在吉钦开自己的染坊了。
Well, yesterday I asked him to help me with the elderberry leaves. I couldn't pick it all myself, a pile like that.
嗯，昨天我请他帮忙拿些接骨木莓叶。我自己一个人搞不定，那可是一大堆的叶子呢。
So I'll go for more elderberry leaves then.
那我得多拿些接骨木莓叶了。
And while we're on the subject, go and get more elderberry leaves.
说到这里，再去拿些接骨木莓叶吧。
And we're only putting elderberry in there. The real dyes smell different.
我们只放了接骨木莓叶。真正的染料闻起来可不是这种味道。
…than bothering some poor carpenter who threw a scrap of linen in a trough with elderberry leaves.
…他们可没功夫管一个木匠把一块亚麻布扔进接骨木莓叶槽这样的小事。
Or I'll smack you so hard your own <hic>mother wouldn't recognize you!
否则我就把你打得连你妈都认不出来！
Hey there, lad! <hic>Buy me a beer!
嘿，小伙子！给我买杯啤酒！
游牧民已经在维德拉克定居。
The fortress struck me as very well stocked with ammunition - arrows, crossbow bolts…
堡垒给我的印象是弹药储备充足——箭矢、弩箭…
Weapons, plate armour, chain mail. I swear, Sir, enough for a small army!
军火、铁甲、链甲。我发誓，大人，它们的数量足够装备一支小型军队！
Alright, alright. Just because we're going to talk to him, doesn't mean we have to torture him straight away.
好吧，好吧。我们要向他问话，并不代表我们得马上对他用刑。
My respects, Sir Otto. I am Sir Hans Capon of Pirkstein and this is Henry of Skalitz, my escort.
向你问好，奥托爵士。我是皮克斯坦因的汉斯·卡蓬爵士，这是我的护卫，斯卡里茨的亨利。
Why? I already beat you. And Tuma and Stanley too.
为什么？我已经打败过你了。还有斯塔尼克和图马也是。
But if Stanley saw me beat someone that kicked his arse, maybe he'd leave me alone.
但如果斯塔尼克看到我打败了曾揍过他的人，他可能会离我远点。
Do you think I stand a chance against Stanley now?
你觉得我现在对上斯塔尼克会有机会吗？
晚上好，斯卡里茨的亨利！
Do piče! It shit outside, fuck!
Do pice！天气真是太糟了，该死！
Fuj…! Do piče, Henry! You smell like dungheap!
Fuj…! Do pice，亨利！你臭得像粪堆！
Piče…! I have enough of this shit.
It's good to see you, Jan.
Storms remind me of the razing of Skalitz. It was pouring down just like this when it happened.
暴风雨让我想起了斯卡里茨的毁灭。事情发生时就像这样大雨滂沱。
So here we are. Zamur’s altar.
So here we are. Zamur’s altar.
That sounds like a damned quick way to meet the Lord…
That sounds like a damned quick way to meet the Lord…
Rubbish. It will always be the speed race, no matter what some gadjo says.
Rubbish. It will always be the speed race, no matter what some gadjo says.
You call your mare something else as well. I cannot even pronounce it... Tu’mnii eh?
You call your mare something else as well. I cannot even pronounce it... Tu’mnii eh?
Sar kames. Ale o oltaris hin le Zamooreskero!
Sar kames. Ale o oltaris hin le Zamooreskero!
Sorry, Henry, this has nothing to do with you...
Sorry, Henry, this has nothing to do with you...
He did it for the money anyway. Do not read anything into it.
He did it for the money anyway. Do not read anything into it.
What the hell is that supposed to mean?
What the hell is that supposed to mean?
Let me help you a bit more with this decision.
Let me help you a bit more with this decision.
Then why did you rush into racing?
Then why did you rush into racing?
We need to decorate the altar a bit more.
We need to decorate the altar a bit more.
Ah! Better to come my way so you really see what racing is about. You might change your mind yet.
Ah! Better to come my way so you really see what racing is about. You might change your mind yet.
Damn it Bibrek! Ujaravas hoy oda skushineha!
Damn it Bibrek! Ujaravas hoy oda skushineha!
Hey, we agreed to abide by his word, so stick to it.
Hey, we agreed to abide by his word, so stick to it.
And I appreciate that. The same goes for Zamur, who will watch over you on the road from now on.
And I appreciate that. The same goes for Zamur, who will watch over you on the road from now on.
I even know that Bibrek’s mare is First-of-a-Thousand. Tu’mnii, eh?
I even know that Bibrek’s mare is First-of-a-Thousand. Tu’mnii, eh?
If you want to try racing again, you know where to find me.
If you want to try racing again, you know where to find me.
Not a chance! Everyone knows I was the one who built this altar!
Not a chance! Everyone knows I was the one who built this altar!
First-of-a-Thousand really is a lovely name...
First-of-a-Thousand really is a lovely name...
Well, you see how it is…
Well, you see how it is…
Thanks. If you ever need baskets or straw for targets, feel free to drop by our place.
Thanks. If you ever need baskets or straw for targets, feel free to drop by our place.
See? Unlike you, he has something in his head!
See? Unlike you, he has something in his head!
Look around! Only dark, dangerous woods everywhere. Yet Zamur’s spirit protects us - in camp, on the roads and during races.
Look around! Only dark, dangerous woods everywhere. Yet Zamur’s spirit protects us - in camp, on the roads and during races.
Here, at least take something from us as a keepsake.
Here, at least take something from us as a keepsake.
Ha! He pulled the wool over your eyes. The altar belongs to Zamur and that is that.
Ha! He pulled the wool over your eyes. The altar belongs to Zamur and that is that.
I thought you guarded the secret of those horseshoes of yours.
I thought you guarded the secret of those horseshoes of yours.
Do you think so? True enough, it could handle two or three more piercing arrows.
Do you think so? True enough, it could handle two or three more piercing arrows.
Such a gadjo, and he still outsmarted us, did he not?
Such a gadjo, and he still outsmarted us, did he not?
Pash tu o grai cha bandjola u so me leha kerava? We are starting with a race!
Pash tu o grai cha bandjola u so me leha kerava? We are starting with a race!
If you decide in my favour, I will teach you a riding technique you cannot learn anywhere else.
If you decide in my favour, I will teach you a riding technique you cannot learn anywhere else.
He did it for the money anyway. And he messed it up as well, did he not?
He did it for the money anyway. And he messed it up as well, did he not?
I heard Zamur’s spirit hammering horseshoes here.
I heard Zamur’s spirit hammering horseshoes here.
Only you are shooting at straw dummies and targets stuck together with manure, oh mighty warrior!
Only you are shooting at straw dummies and targets stuck together with manure, oh mighty warrior!
What good is a chamfron? The horse can hardly see the road in it.
What good is a chamfron? The horse can hardly see the road in it.
You started claiming it only after I dedicated it to Zamur! Before that you did not care about it.
You started claiming it only after I dedicated it to Zamur! Before that you did not care about it.
Me and my horse had a great time.
Me and my horse had a great time.
I've completed the challenges. You and Mikolai promised to abide by my ruling.
I've completed the challenges. You and Mikolai promised to abide by my ruling.
What if I want to end the race early?
What if I want to end the race early?
What was it you said I had to do so I can ride in the race?
What was it you said I had to do so I can ride in the race?
You two are quite a pair. But let's not spend three days over this...
You two are quite a pair. But let's not spend three days over this...
I'm glad you spoke up. I’m looking for some riding competitions.
I'm glad you spoke up. I’m looking for some riding competitions.
All that bouncing on horseback has given me a wooden backside.
All that bouncing on horseback has given me a wooden backside.
Look, we're supposed to be racing and here you are squabbling over a heap of rocks. Can't you just drop it?
Look, we're supposed to be racing and here you are squabbling over a heap of rocks. Can't you just drop it?
Isn't it enough that I completed your part? Maybe we can convince him now.
Isn't it enough that I completed your part? Maybe we can convince him now.
Then I shall decide. What do you say?
Then I shall decide. What do you say?
Tell me once more, how do you measure time?
Tell me once more, how do you measure time?
How do you know how much time I have and how much I’ve got left?
How do you know how much time I have and how much I’ve got left?
Firing a bow from the saddle is surely more difficult and also more useful.
Firing a bow from the saddle is surely more difficult and also more useful.
You said he’s holding races here too, right?
You said he’s holding races here too, right?
You would pass up the queen of all riding contests? No chance!
You would pass up the queen of all riding contests? No chance!
I could try to find somebody like that. A groom or a stable owner...?
I could try to find somebody like that. A groom or a stable owner...?
A joust with lances, horses in caparisons, riders in full armour.
A joust with lances, horses in caparisons, riders in full armour.
I rode those three races for Mikolai. Can't we settle your quarrel right now?
I rode those three races for Mikolai. Can't we settle your quarrel right now?
I spoke with Mikolai, and he said you’re in charge of something like that here.
I spoke with Mikolai, and he said you’re in charge of something like that here.
I reckon like I managed the mounted archery pretty well.
I reckon like I managed the mounted archery pretty well.
Can’t you explain it in a clearer way? How long will it take?
Can’t you explain it in a clearer way? How long will it take?
And to mounted archery in general. It was the most enjoyable and the altar should honour it.
And to mounted archery in general. It was the most enjoyable and the altar should honour it.
And to racing in general, which was the most fun for me, and the altar should be dedicated to it.
And to racing in general, which was the most fun for me, and the altar should be dedicated to it.
Alright… but what about the race? How does it work here?
Alright… but what about the race? How does it work here?
Why, a knightly tournament of course!
这可是骑士级别的比赛！
What is the matter? Did something happen?
What is the matter? Did something happen?
I've conscientiously completed both of your challenges and I must say...
I've conscientiously completed both of your challenges and I must say...
But you haven't asked anyone yourselves, have you?
But you haven't asked anyone yourselves, have you?
I’m looking for someone who organises riding competitions around here.
I’m looking for someone who organises riding competitions around here.
At least I'm not leaving empty-handed.
At least I'm not leaving empty-handed.
So I ride races and shoot like a fool and you just toss me aside? Farewell then...
So I ride races and shoot like a fool and you just toss me aside? Farewell then...
That should do it... Do you need anything else?
That should do it... Do you need anything else?
Alright, I can picture that now.
Alright, I can picture that now.
I almost took offence, but you wanted to save the best for last, did you not?
I almost took offence, but you wanted to save the best for last, did you not?
Both of them. To Zamur and to Karachin.
Both of them. To Zamur and to Karachin.
I want to think it over again.
I want to think it over again.
Why do the Cumans bother you? Aren’t you one yourself by any chance?
Why do the Cumans bother you? Aren’t you one yourself by any chance?
So what exactly is mounted archery like? What do I need to know?
So what exactly is mounted archery like? What do I need to know?
Nothing proves a horse’s qualities and a rider’s skill better than an honest race.
Nothing proves a horse’s qualities and a rider’s skill better than an honest race.
First past the Town's end and Tuft?
First past the Town's end and Tuft?
First of a Hundred and Tooth?
First of a Hundred and Tooth?
And Mikolai rides Tooth. In their tongue he is called Dand.
And Mikolai rides Tooth. In their tongue he is called Dand.
So that is why you are holding your races up there! You fear the woods, so you would rather run your horse across a field!
So that is why you are holding your races up there! You fear the woods, so you would rather run your horse across a field!
He helped reconcile Marika with our Vajda. Perhaps he will help me now.
He helped reconcile Marika with our Vajda. Perhaps he will help me now.
Indeed, I never thought he would recall the names.
Indeed, I never thought he would recall the names.
And likewise, where you can shoot up close because the next target is far away.
And likewise, where you can shoot up close because the next target is far away.
I’m glad to meet anyone who wants to honour the long tradition of mounted archery.
I’m glad to meet anyone who wants to honour the long tradition of mounted archery.
I am Iasian! And my horse, First of a Thousand, is Kangly.
I am Iasian! And my horse, First of a Thousand, is Kangly.
You will be the first to ride mounted archery with a blessing from both Karachin and Zamur.
You will be the first to ride mounted archery with a blessing from both Karachin and Zamur.
Time will run out, I will take the stake, pack up the targets, and go and have my gruel.
Time will run out, I will take the stake, pack up the targets, and go and have my gruel.
If you do not want to guide the horse yourself, let it follow the path. It will find the right route on its own.
If you do not want to guide the horse yourself, let it follow the path. It will find the right route on its own.
Nonsense. I say nonsense. A lövészet az igazi művészet, kár is a szóért.
Nonsense. I say nonsense. A lövészet az igazi művészet, kár is a szóért.
I will give you hoofing around! Mounted archery is a noble art. So…?
I will give you hoofing around! Mounted archery is a noble art. So…?
Whatever you stake, if you win you get double.
Whatever you stake, if you win you get double.
You promised not to dispute Henry’s ruling.
You promised not to dispute Henry’s ruling.
Anything bigger will not let you reload on horseback, and you will only embarrass yourself.
Anything bigger will not let you reload on horseback, and you will only embarrass yourself.
Who knows what madness might happen…
Who knows what madness might happen…
Grandfather Karachin would likely be pleased if we made peace.
Grandfather Karachin would likely be pleased if we made peace.
If you let him, your horse will find the right path on his own.
If you let him, your horse will find the right path on his own.
He already knows our Vajda. Marika did not return but he did not refuse him help.
He already knows our Vajda. Marika did not return but he did not refuse him help.
Well, who does it belong to?
Well, who does it belong to?
Now the third and last course awaits you.
Now the third and last course awaits you.
And Cumans, Mordvins, Kipchaks, and Seljuks too, those are sheep...
And Cumans, Mordvins, Kipchaks, and Seljuks too, those are sheep...
Knowing Mikolai, your horse will at best produce stinking heaps like all the woes of the world.
Knowing Mikolai, your horse will at best produce stinking heaps like all the woes of the world.
Anyway, back to the point. Which will you ride?
Anyway, back to the point. Which will you ride?
In the evening, we will drink a toast to that rascal, alright?
In the evening, we will drink a toast to that rascal, alright?
You did want to try archery, did you not?
You did want to try archery, did you not?
But since we already have you here, Henry...
But since we already have you here, Henry...
As I said, you have proved yourself with me. However you judge things, I will not dispute it.
As I said, you have proved yourself with me. However you judge things, I will not dispute it.
Sure, talk with him if you want… but you are only wasting time.
Sure, talk with him if you want… but you are only wasting time.
Well, look who we have here. The big champion of galloping horses across fields has come for a proper challenge.
Well, look who we have here. The big champion of galloping horses across fields has come for a proper challenge.
For each course, I keep a rhythm in my head.
For each course, I keep a rhythm in my head.
Every rider must bow to it before the competition. That is our custom.
Every rider must bow to it before the competition. That is our custom.
By drumbeats. One course might have forty beats, another eighty-five.
By drumbeats. One course might have forty beats, another eighty-five.
Nice. But between you and me, do not let Mikolai get his hands on it or he will cripple someone, maybe himself.
Nice. But between you and me, do not let Mikolai get his hands on it or he will cripple someone, maybe himself.
You see, we Iasians are something like… bulls.
I scattered it myself to drive away evil forces from Karachin’s grave, you fool!
I scattered it myself to drive away evil forces from Karachin’s grave, you fool!
And when the race is halfway done, I blow the horn.
And when the race is halfway done, I blow the horn.
Believe me, I have known Mikolai longer than you have.
Believe me, I have known Mikolai longer than you have.
If you forget something, feel free to ask. I will not bite.
If you forget something, feel free to ask. I will not bite.
Haha, right on target. Though he mostly calls his horse Dand. That is in their tongue.
Haha, right on target. Though he mostly calls his horse Dand. That is in their tongue.
Shooting from horseback gets easier with practice. You will get used to the rhythm of firing and reloading.
Shooting from horseback gets easier with practice. You will get used to the rhythm of firing and reloading.
You gallop, you shoot. Targets fall and the groschen pile up.
You gallop, you shoot. Targets fall and the groschen pile up.
Hey, listen. If you ever need help with those races, just say the word.
Hey, listen. If you ever need help with those races, just say the word.
Sometimes we go for forty drumbeats, sometimes fifty-five, and sometimes eighty-five.
Sometimes we go for forty drumbeats, sometimes fifty-five, and sometimes eighty-five.
When you come to me, have a bow or a small crossbow on your back. I need to see right away that you are ready.
When you come to me, have a bow or a small crossbow on your back. I need to see right away that you are ready.
Bow, crossbow. Arrow, bolt. Horse. A steady hand and sharp eyes.
Bow, crossbow. Arrow, bolt. Horse. A steady hand and sharp eyes.
First get yourself a bow. Or a small crossbow.
First get yourself a bow. Or a small crossbow.
Mounted archery, of course! While the horse is still fresh.
Mounted archery, of course! While the horse is still fresh.
Come to me instead. Obviously you have not really got to know mounted archery yet.
Come to me instead. Obviously you have not really got to know mounted archery yet.
Mikolai. He trades horses here at the camp, and of course he is also a skilled rider.
Mikolai. He trades horses here at the camp, and of course he is also a skilled rider.
I built this altar here. It is Karachin’s grave!
I built this altar here. It is Karachin’s grave!
We are halfway through the race! Boom, boom!
We are halfway through the race! Boom, boom!
Do not stop in front of the targets. If you miss, you miss - stopping will just cost you precious time.
Do not stop in front of the targets. If you miss, you miss - stopping will just cost you precious time.
Perhaps you would find it helpful to know how things work here, yes?
Perhaps you would find it helpful to know how things work here, yes?
Why are you just standing there? Induljunk!
Why are you just standing there? Induljunk!
And we shall keep that promise. We will decide it at the altar, right before Karachin’s eyes.
And we shall keep that promise. We will decide it at the altar, right before Karachin’s eyes.
...but at least he is not a Cuman.
...but at least he is not a Cuman.
What do you think? He is not one of us.
What do you think? He is not one of us.
I hang three types of targets around the course.
I hang three types of targets around the course.
Am I to carry you on my back? Get yourself a horse.
Am I to carry you on my back? Get yourself a horse.
After what you pulled last time?! Not a chance!
After what you pulled last time?! Not a chance!
Ask around the camp. Everyone will tell you the altar is mine!
Ask around the camp. Everyone will tell you the altar is mine!
You tried to trick us and it did not work.
You tried to trick us and it did not work.
Haha, you missed like a Cuman misses a target...
Haha, you missed like a Cuman misses a target...
Nice. But between us do not let Mikolai get his hands on it or he will poke his eye out.
Nice. But between us do not let Mikolai get his hands on it or he will poke his eye out.
If you shoot the same, you just get your stake back. And if you score too few, you get nothing.
If you shoot the same, you just get your stake back. And if you score too few, you get nothing.
I do not see any weapon on your back that is used for shooting around here.
I do not see any weapon on your back that is used for shooting around here.
You cheat! Mit képzelsz, mit csinálsz?
You cheat! Mit képzelsz, mit csinálsz?
Henry, this is a serious matter.
Henry, this is a serious matter.
One thing at a time… there is an altar in the woods over there that I built to the great Iasian marksman Karachin.
One thing at a time… there is an altar in the woods over there that I built to the great Iasian marksman Karachin.
I dug up four arrowheads here, a harness and a kindjal! It is clear!
I dug up four arrowheads here, a harness and a kindjal! It is clear!
If your horse leaves a pile there, you will answer to me! Let us go!
If your horse leaves a pile there, you will answer to me! Let us go!
A bow or a small crossbow. I will always give you a bit of ammunition at the start.
A bow or a small crossbow. I will always give you a bit of ammunition at the start.
I paced it all out myself, so the paths are narrow and the horses can only manage a canter. They are afraid to go faster.
I paced it all out myself, so the paths are narrow and the horses can only manage a canter. They are afraid to go faster.
We ride up above the camp, where I have set up a circuit.
We ride up above the camp, where I have set up a circuit.
Do not interrupt, Mikolai. And get lost while you are at it!
Do not interrupt, Mikolai. And get lost while you are at it!
Here it is. Karachin’s altar in all its splendour.
Here it is. Karachin’s altar in all its splendour.
I will set up the course I call Wineskin.
I will set up the course I call Wineskin.
Sixty drumbeats is a schock. That’s about… three Lord’s Prayers.
Sixty drumbeats is a schock. That’s about… three Lord’s Prayers.
He is a decent enough rider, and that is about the only good thing I can say about him. Well, at least he is not a Cuman.
He is a decent enough rider, and that is about the only good thing I can say about him. Well, at least he is not a Cuman.
So you see? Everyone with sense knows that shooting is better than racing.
So you see? Everyone with sense knows that shooting is better than racing.
First, you will ride the course I call Torque. It is more than enough to get acquainted with mounted archery.
First, you will ride the course I call Torque. It is more than enough to get acquainted with mounted archery.
You see, I am training - for the likes of you!
You see, I am training - for the likes of you!
Let us see what you have got.
Let us see what you have got.
Why are you not riding? Hyaah!
Why are you not riding? Hyaah!
Fine, we understand, but what about the altar?
Fine, we understand, but what about the altar?
That flatbread baked nicely too. It is a pity someone threw it onto a filthy stone.
That flatbread baked nicely too. It is a pity someone threw it onto a filthy stone.
You could put even more arrows there, in case anybody fails to get the point.
You could put even more arrows there, in case anybody fails to get the point.
You know what I am thinking, Mik?
You know what I am thinking, Mik?
Then you will figure out where it is better to shoot from a distance, giving you more time to reload.
Then you will figure out where it is better to shoot from a distance, giving you more time to reload.
Alright, let's get to it. You trust me to judge fairly and end this dispute.
Alright, let's get to it. You trust me to judge fairly and end this dispute.
Perhaps it will help you win some silver that you can wager with us next time.
Perhaps it will help you win some silver that you can wager with us next time.
It is not much harder than the first one, but its shape is a bit different. Halfway through, it crosses the centre of the loop.
It is not much harder than the first one, but its shape is a bit different. Halfway through, it crosses the centre of the loop.
Baromság! Az oltár Krachiné, és pofa be!
Baromság! Az oltár Krachiné, és pofa be!
See? It is obvious. The altar belongs to Karachin.
See? It is obvious. The altar belongs to Karachin.
Before you ride your first race, you must know at least the basic rules.
Before you ride your first race, you must know at least the basic rules.
It just goes in a loop, so let your horse follow the path. It will leave your hands free for shooting.
It just goes in a loop, so let your horse follow the path. It will leave your hands free for shooting.
You do not have to hit every target.
You do not have to hit every target.
Just go ahead and leave, if you want.
Just go ahead and leave, if you want.
If you have not reloaded for one of them, skip it and be all the more ready for the next one.
If you have not reloaded for one of them, skip it and be all the more ready for the next one.
The Cumans are lazy, and Mik from the nomads is just the same.
The Cumans are lazy, and Mik from the nomads is just the same.
When half the time is up, I’ll blow a horn so you know how you’re doing.
When half the time is up, I’ll blow a horn so you know how you’re doing.
For the second challenge, you could try Hounskull.
For the second challenge, you could try Hounskull.
Bow at the altar of the marksman Karachin. Then you can go and saddle your horse in peace.
Bow at the altar of the marksman Karachin. Then you can go and saddle your horse in peace.
That we did not find common ground until the same outsider tried to swindle both of us.
That we did not find common ground until the same outsider tried to swindle both of us.
So you’re like quarrelling neighbours? How did you ever end up here?
So you’re like quarrelling neighbours? How did you ever end up here?
I hum different tunes in my head for it.
I hum different tunes in my head for it.
Hmm... That doesn't look good, a bit more and I'll fuck it up.
嗯…这看起来不太好，差一点就搞砸了。
Just a bit more and I'll be done.
再加把劲就大功告成了。
I'll never finish it like this, I should move it.
这样我永远也做不完，我得移动它。
This is useless, I should move it.
I'm glad Bohush is alive and well. But he shouldn't have gone to live with the nomads.
很高兴博胡什还活着并且一切安好。不过他真不该跟那些游牧民住在一起。
The Lord giveth and the Lord taketh away!
God sees you, and you're pissing him off!
人在做，天再看，你惹怒上帝了！
If you say so. But I'm glad to see you've still got that boy from Skalitz in you.
随你便。不过你没有丢失本性，还是那个来自斯卡里茨的男孩。我很高兴。
There's life in this old dog yet!
We have to knock down the ladders, I can't leave.
我们得推到这些梯子，我不能离开。
I can't move back, we have to fend off the ladders!
不能后退，我们得先推倒这些梯子！
将那些天杀的梯子推倒！
You have a unique chance to try it out. From the right end for a change.
这下你有机会从这一端亲自试试看了。
Come and get a free indulgence, eh?!
给你一次免费的特赦吧，嗯？
What's keeping you? Should I go and get drunk and come back later?
还在磨蹭啥？要不我去喝到烂醉再回来收拾你！
I tried a chamomile decoction. But he's in too much pain to fall asleep.
我用了甘菊药剂，但是他痛得根本睡不着。
It's called a pistole! You'll see something you've never seen before!
这叫手铳！这玩意能让你大开眼界！
A pistole is not all that complicated. It has a metal barrel in the front and you hold it in the back.
手铳并没有那么复杂。它的前端有一个金属管，你的手要握在后端。
No problem. I have one handgonne here and it's no good to Plechan anymore. Do you want it?
没问题。我这里有一支手铳，它对普莱查恩来说已经没有用了。你要吗？
Scruffy. Or Jan, Nicholas, Franz, Peter, Jakub. The most bland everyday names.
“脏兮兮”。或者扬、尼古拉斯、弗朗茨、彼得、雅库布。都是一些最平淡无奇的普通名字。
Jesus! And you know where to look for such a pit full of carcasses, do you?
天呐！那你知道这种全是动物尸体的矿坑要去哪里找吗？
She saved my life in my home town, Skalitz, when I went to bury my parents.
我在我的家乡斯卡里茨埋葬我的父母时，她救了我的命。
At them! Kill that bastard with the mace first!
干掉他们！先杀了那个拿钉头锤的杂碎！
Don't tell me, they stink of sulphur and eat stray children.
别告诉我，你真信他们身上有硫磺味，还会吃走失的小孩儿。
I've been to their camp and found one just like it there.
我去过他们的营地，在那儿见过你说的这种的马蹄铁。
I've heard you have work for a blacksmith here.
我听说你这里有铁匠的活儿可以干。
I can do all sorts of things. But originally I'm a blacksmith.
各种工作我都会。不过，我本来是个铁匠。
I thought about those horseshoes you wanted from me.
关于你想要的那种马蹄铁，我好好考虑过了。
I'm looking for work, do you know about any?
我在找活儿干，你知道有什么工作可做吗？
I'm not afraid of horses. I know when to let go of a hoof and avoid a kick in the face.
马吓不到我。我知道什么时候该放开马蹄，免得被踢到脸。
Hang on, I should have them here somewhere.
等等，我身上好像还带着呢。
Where did you hear a fable like that?
这种童话故事你从哪儿听来的？
It'll take me a while to make a full set, but I'll see what I can do…
做一整套得费些时间，但我会尽力而为的……
Sure, why not? I could use some horseshoes like that myself.
当然可以，这有什么问题？这样的马蹄铁，我自己也求之不得呢。
My word! What you could do with horseshoes like that!
那还用说！有了这样的马蹄铁，那可真就厉害了！
等等，我知道那种马蹄铁！
I'll have to think about it.
But he has to be a brave blacksmith. I need to shoe a horse. The saddler wants me to race for him.
不过，那得是个胆大的铁匠才行。我要给一匹马钉蹄铁，鞍匠想让我帮他去比赛。
Thank you! I'll win this race even if I have to shoe a pig with them!
多谢！就算给头猪装上这马蹄铁，我也能赢得这场比赛！
Fable? You hear all sorts of things about them fellahs around here…
童话故事？在这地方，关于那些人的离奇故事多了去了……
Look, if you don't believe me, go and take a look for yourself.
喂，你要是不信我，那就自己去瞧瞧。
Then if you forge some for me, I'll reward you handsomely. What do you say?
然后你要是能再帮我做一套，我必定重重酬谢。怎么样？
If you find out how they make them horseshoes and forge some for me yourself, I'll make it worth your while…
要是你能弄清楚他们是怎么打造那种马蹄铁的，再帮我做一套，我不会亏待你的……
And? Will you go to the camp to find out more about them?
然后呢？你愿意跑一趟营地，去了解一下吗？
What a stroke of luck! If you forge me a full set, I'll pay you handsomely!
真是太走运了！你要是能给我打制一套，我一定重重答谢！
Take a good look around there. Or try asking someone who's in charge of horses.
到他们营地去好好探查一下。或者找负责马匹的人问问。
Word is they're forged in hellfire and have all sorts of incantations carved into them. A horse wearing them can climb up a sheer cliff without tripping once!
据说这种马蹄铁是在地狱之火中锻造的，上面还刻着各种咒语。装上之后，就算是攀爬陡峭的悬崖，马蹄都不会打滑！
That depends on what you can do.
I'd save up for the best horse I could find and win races all over the kingdom!
我要攒钱，买下最棒的马，到时候整个王国的比赛，冠军都不在话下！
I heard the nomads from the camp by the pond use horseshoes that are… magical.
我听说湖边营地里的游牧民用的马蹄铁……有魔力。
One wrong step and you'll break both your own neck and your horse's.
一步不稳，骑手和马都得摔断脖子。
Well don't take too long, the race is fast approaching and I need those horsehoes!
好吧，可别考虑太久，比赛眼看就要开始了，我急需那种马蹄铁！
Kick be damned! The main thing is I need some good horseshoes. It's all rocks and bogs around these parts.
被踢到算什么！最关键的是，我需要好的马蹄铁。这附近到处都是岩石和沼泽。
You know what? How about you go to their camp and find out how the horseshoes are made?
对了，要不你去一趟游牧民的营地打听打听，看他们究竟是怎么打造那种马蹄铁的？
That would make for some fine racing…
肯定能赢得几场精彩的比赛……
That's what I like to hear!
The millers are just village vagrants.
磨坊主们不过是群乡巴佬。
Right under our noses as a provocation!
就在我们眼皮底下，赤裸裸的挑衅！
And Ambrose was keen on me as well once, just like his brother Jan.
安布洛斯也曾经钟情于我，跟他的弟弟约翰一样。
Kuttenberg isn't some wee hamlet like Skalitz. This is the second biggest city in the kingdom after Prague.
库滕堡不像斯卡里茨那样偏僻。这可是继布拉格之后的王国第二大城市。
One more thing, Burgrave. Their commander - was he a big man in armour with a mace?
还有件事，城伯。他们的指挥官是穿着盔甲拿着钉头锤的大个子吗？
They ambushed us from hiding... There was a terrible explosion, smoke everywhere, and they showered us with crossbow bolts and God knows what else...
他们从暗处袭击我们…最开始有场爆炸，浓烟四起，随后一大堆弩箭朝我们飞来，天知道还有些什么…
Of course, we also had a smelter in Skalitz, but how much do you make?
当然，斯卡里茨也有一座冶炼厂，但你们能赚多少呢？
There was this captain, Robard was his name, a good man. He said justice and his mace would catch up with those bastards.
有个队长，叫罗伯德，是个好人。他说他会追上那些杂碎，用他的钉头锤伸张正义。
Hm, there wasn't anything like that back in Skalitz.
嗯，在斯卡里茨可没有这样的事。
From Skalitz, you say? Where's that?
你说来自斯卡里茨？那是哪里？
You call yourself Henry of Skalitz, right? Where is that?
你自称是斯卡里茨的亨利，对吗？那个地方在哪里？
Köszönöm a nőt. Ha majd te fogsz nőt keresni nálunk, én is segítek neked.
Koszonom a not. Ha majd te fogsz not keresni nálunk, én is segítek neked.（谢谢你帮我追那个女孩。如果你相中我们这儿的哪个姑娘，我也会帮忙的。）
Egy ilyen nő miatt el tudnám képzelni, hogy itt maradjak. Jó itt nálatok.
Egy ilyen no miatt el tudnám képzelni, hogy itt maradjak. Jó itt nálatok.（如果我遇到心仪的姑娘，我会留下来的。）
But it'll be the two of us who catch up with them, and his very own mace that I pummel him with!
不过追上他们的只有我们两个，我还要用他自己的钉头锤狠狠揍他！
Aye! A mace… and he was damned good with it! That villain is no ordinary bandit, I'll tell you.
没错！钉头锤…他打得真他妈不错！那恶棍不是普通的强盗，我跟你说。
But you wait until we find that moonshine.
不过你还是等我们找到那些私酒以后再动手吧。
Lačhes, lačhes! It is like you have been speaking our language all your life!
Laches, laches（没错，没错）！你说起我们的语言真是轻车熟路！
I am no khartyas, but I know how to shoe a grai. Why?
我不是铁匠，但钉蹄铁的手艺我还是有的。怎么了？
Hey, leave me alone and stop sticking your nose in here!
嘿，别烦我，别在这里到处瞎打听！
Who told you something like that?
Khul! I am an honest, God-fearing man! What have you heard?
Khul！我是个诚实本分、敬畏上帝的人！你都听说了什么？
The main thing is to know where you will be riding your grai. Based on that, you can choose horseshoes.
关键是你得清楚，自己的马要在什么样的路面上跑，才能选择合适的马蹄铁。
Khul! Magical? Where did you hear that?
Khul！有魔力？你从哪儿听说的？
Well next time, ask somewhere else!
那下次去别的地方问去！
You talk good, gadjo. I see you know horses.
你很会说话嘛，gadjo。一看你就是识马的行家。
They bite into ground and grai can even climb up a cliff. Although he will not be too happy about it.
它们能牢牢抓住地面，让马甚至能爬上悬崖，虽然马可能不太乐意。
You see, it is the same for horseshoes as for our shoes.
马蹄铁这东西，就跟人的鞋子一样。
Such nonsense! I have all sorts of horseshoes, but there is nothing magical about them.
胡说八道！我这儿什么样的马蹄铁都有，但跟魔法可沾不上边。
Khartyas? Now you are speaking my language.
你是个charťas？那咱们肯定有不少共同话题。
There are hard rocks all around here, often wet, so I got these.
这儿周围净是硬石头，还总是湿漉漉的，所以我才做了这个。
I've heard you have the best horses around, so I was wondering if you have any special horseshoes as well.
我听说你这里有这一片最好的马，所以想问问，你是不是也有什么独门秘制的马蹄铁。
What do you nomads actually do for a living?
你们游牧民在这里以什么为生？
Does it matter? Just tell me how you shoe those horses of yours, will you?
这很重要吗？你就告诉我你是怎么给马钉蹄铁的，不行吗？
I'm a blacksmith, you see? I know my horseshoes, but I've heard you have some kind of special ones.
我是个铁匠，所以我也很懂马蹄铁，但我听说你这里有相当特别的货。
You know, I probably shouldn't say, but I've heard some bad things about you…
好吧，我本不该多嘴，但我确实听说过一些关于你的不太好的传言……
Are you the one who takes care of the horses here?
你是这儿负责照看马匹的人吗？
I've never seen horseshoes like these. What are the spikes for?
我从没见过这样的马蹄铁。这些刺是做什么用的？
What's life like among the nomads?
I don't believe rumours, but I've heard you're involved in some dark magic.
留言我是不信的，但我听说你对黑魔法有一些涉猎。
That doesn't matter. Is it true or not?
这不重要。到底是真的还是假的？
Alright, easy! I was just asking.
好吧好吧，冷静点儿！我就随便问问。
I've heard you have some sort of special horseshoes here. Magical…
我听说你这里有种很特别的马蹄铁，是有魔力的……
I've shod a few horses myself and I'm not inexperienced in the saddle…
我自己也动手钉过一些马蹄铁，跟马打交道也有些年头了……
I’ll be dead by morning anyway.
Aren't you that boy who ran away from us?
你就是那个从我们手下逃走的小伙子吗？
Surround them! Don't let them get away!
包围他们，别让他们跑了！
I'm still strong enough to get on your back!
Hurry! Load up everything you get your hands on! Stones to the wall! All weapons to the gate!
将你们能找到的所有东西都装上！把石头搬到城墙上！带好武器到城门！
The pond looks inviting, and we've got wine enough.
这池塘倒别有一番意境，酒也够喝。
I bear a letter for Sir Otto von Bergow from my master, Sir Hanush of Leipa.
吾奉莱佩的瀚纳什大人之命，前来给奥托·冯·波尔高大人送信。
Mind your step. Two can play that game.
注意点，要是敢动歪脑筋，我也能跟你玩这一套。
When your self-proclaimed king finds that out, your head will be on the chopping block.
要是被你那位自封的国王知道，你就等着掉脑袋吧。
Only a handful of loyalists stand by the rightful king…
忠臣寥寥…… 王道渺渺……
苏赫多尔城堡，一四零三年（大明永乐元年）
I'll show you a move using both hands. I call it the scissor strike.
我会让你见识一招双手并用的技巧。我称之为“剪刀式”。
Wenn du wirklich Interesse hast, I'll show you one of my favourite blows with a mace to the chin, was sagst du dazu?
Wenn du wirklich Interesse hast,（所以，如果你有兴趣），我可以给你演示我最喜欢的一招，也就是用钉头锤猛击别人的下巴，was sagst du dazu（意下如何）？
If you like to fight with a mace or an axe, I'll show you a way that's guaranteed to send your opponent to the ground.
如果你喜欢使用钉头锤和斧头战斗的话，我可以教你一招，保证能让你的敌人倒地不起。
A warrior should be able to take down an enemy even without a weapon. If you want, I'll show a move I like to call the scissor strike.
哪怕没有武器，一个战士也应该能做到徒手把敌人放倒。你如果有兴趣，我可以给你演示一招，我称之为“剪刀式”。
Ich werde dich lehren, how to to get opponent to ground with a mace. Praktisch, nicht wahr?
Ich werde dich lehren（我要教你），如果用钉头锤击败对手。Praktisch, nicht wahr（很有用的，怎么说）？
If you like fight with mace or axe, I show you how to stomp opponent to ground.
如果你喜欢用钉头锤或者斧头战斗，我可以教你如何把对手掀翻。
I don't know if an apology's will do… what about some schnapps?
我不知道道歉能不能解决问题…来点烈酒怎么样？
Abbot Jan and the Malien parish priest Peter are present as our opposition.
修道院院长扬和马林教区牧师彼得反对我们。
The Brotherhood is represented by Father Konrad of Pnewitz and his underling, Father Anthony of Wysoka.
兄弟会的代表是普内维茨的神父康拉德，以及他的部下，来自维索卡的安东尼神父。
Which ones are you interested in?
Which ones are you interested in?
Do not let it happen again!
Do not let it happen again!
I would organise it for you, but I do not have enough riders.
I would organise it for you, but I do not have enough riders.
I have good news for you!
I have good news for you!
To Semine. There's a little pond across the road from the fortress. Once the race starts, you ride east.
To Semine. There's a little pond across the road from the fortress. Once the race starts, you ride east.
What was that supposed to be?! You will not behave like that at my races!
What was that supposed to be?! You will not behave like that at my races!
Feel like another run? For a change, we do not have to wait all day.
Feel like another run? For a change, we do not have to wait all day.
You will have more routes to choose from and I will put the region’s best riders up against you.
You will have more routes to choose from and I will put the region’s best riders up against you.
Not so good. If only you were at least second…
Not so good. If only you were at least second…
I will keep a closer eye on it next time, trust me. Do come again.
I will keep a closer eye on it next time, trust me. Do come again.
If you want to try again, feel free to drop by. But I will be taking bets and only letting you ride once a day, so the horse is not run into the ground.
If you want to try again, feel free to drop by. But I will be taking bets and only letting you ride once a day, so the horse is not run into the ground.
You did not even get second place…
You did not even get second place…
Tell me more about these checkpoints...
Tell me more about these checkpoints...
While we were racing, someone got into the chest and nicked the stakes...
While we were racing, someone got into the chest and nicked the stakes...
How many groschen will you stake?
How many groschen will you stake?
First place! It was a joy to watch, I tell you.
First place! It was a joy to watch, I tell you.
There is plenty to look forward to!
There is plenty to look forward to!
The first challenge is just a simple warm-up race.
The first challenge is just a simple warm-up race.
Go! No one wants to ride with you now anyway.
Go! No one wants to ride with you now anyway.
For the race, leave only a bridle and saddle on your horse and have decent horseshoes.
For the race, leave only a bridle and saddle on your horse and have decent horseshoes.
You finished just behind the winner.
You finished just behind the winner.
It is already tough enough to find decent riders…
It is already tough enough to find decent riders…
What antics were you up to last time?! These races are a serious matter, not a game!
What antics were you up to last time?! These races are a serious matter, not a game!
Do not ride with a shield or a bow slung across your back. Then you cannot see behind you and you will not notice someone catching up.
Do not ride with a shield or a bow slung across your back. Then you cannot see behind you and you will not notice someone catching up.
Still better than wearing out both your horse and yourself.
Still better than wearing out both your horse and yourself.
You will forfeit your stake and can only race again the following day.
You will forfeit your stake and can only race again the following day.
You will be doing us a favour if you come to me and apologise, so we do not wait for you unnecessarily.
You will be doing us a favour if you come to me and apologise, so we do not wait for you unnecessarily.
Besides your horse's stamina, keep an eye on your own as well. If you tire quickly, have something to bolster you before the race.
Besides your horse's stamina, keep an eye on your own as well. If you tire quickly, have something to bolster you before the race.
Let us do this! As I said, I have figured out the last challenge.
Let us do this! As I said, I have figured out the last challenge.
Like I said, now you will be going for the real race - still without bets, though.
Like I said, now you will be going for the real race - still without bets, though.
You have covered three laps now, so you know what it is like racing with Zamur at your side.
You have covered three laps now, so you know what it is like racing with Zamur at your side.
The rest have to hope for better luck next time.
The rest have to hope for better luck next time.
We have a small spot right next to Bibrek's circuit. Each race starts and finishes there.
We have a small spot right next to Bibrek's circuit. Each race starts and finishes there.
I will collect the stakes and lock them in a chest. They will stay there until the race is over.
I will collect the stakes and lock them in a chest. They will stay there until the race is over.
Once a day, up above the camp, four fellahs meet and arrange a race.
Once a day, up above the camp, four fellahs meet and arrange a race.
The fastest horse is worthless if its legs get tangled in its tack or it is dragging a caparison behind it.
The fastest horse is worthless if its legs get tangled in its tack or it is dragging a caparison behind it.
Tough luck. No stake, no race.
Tough luck. No stake, no race.
You were too slow. That other fellah left you in the dust.
You were too slow. That other fellah left you in the dust.
What if the race just doesn't suit me? Can I quit?
What if the race just doesn't suit me? Can I quit?
You cannot trust anyone these days.
You cannot trust anyone these days.
I’ll take a rest and come back later.
I’ll take a rest and come back later.
Damn, I’ve got nothing to bet.
Damn, I’ve got nothing to bet.
Actually… I’ll have to think about it a bit more.
Actually… I’ll have to think about it a bit more.
Tell me quickly how these races work?
Tell me quickly how these races work?
Tell me right now what you say you didn't understand! Or do you want Ernest to help you think?
快点从实招来！还是说要让欧内斯特来帮你回忆一下？
Ah, Igen, I know now: Skalitz, there silver, Skalitz, igen.
啊，Igen（是的），我知道了：斯卡里茨，那里有银矿，斯卡里茨，igen（没错）。
For fuck's sake, I'm Henry. I'm asking about the Battle of Skalitz.
我的天，我是亨利。我想问你关于斯卡里茨战役的事情。
I'm curious to know, did you hear about the attack on Skalitz?
我很好奇，你听说过攻打斯卡里茨的事情吗？
Damn it, were you there? Were you at the attack on Skalitz?
可恶，你当时在那里吗？你有份攻打斯卡里茨吗？
Zbignev Hare? He strikes me as more of a warrior than a man of faith.
兹比格涅夫·黑尔？在我看来，他更像个战士而不像信徒。
Nobody with any decency would risk his mother's immortal soul, even if he was as pure as the driven snow.
没有什么正派人会拿自己母亲不朽的灵魂冒险，即使他清白如雪。
Nobody with any decency would risk his mother's immortal soul, even if he was pure as the driven snow.
没有什么正派人会拿自己母亲不朽的灵魂冒险，即使他清白如雪。
我来自银之斯卡里茨，爵士。
I just hope we find the horses too. Jarmilka here ain't the youngest, and I wouldn't want to drag it back home myself…
我只希望我们也能找到马。贾尔米卡年纪不小了，而且我也不想自己把它拖回家……
I'm still a nobleman, if you don't mind. So I'm not a thief, I'm a robber baron.
不好意思，我还是个贵族。所以我不是小偷，我是贵族强盗。
I'm still a nobleman, if you don't mind. So I'm not a thief, I'm a robber baron.
不好意思，我还是个贵族。所以我不是小偷，我是贵族强盗。
I had to kill him. Otherwise, I'd never have made it out alive.
我不得已杀了他。否则，我就不可能活着出来了。
You should place your faith in God and not try to appease hell. Instead, be good Christians under Father Marian's guidance!
你们应该相信上帝，不要试图去安抚地狱，而要在神父马里安的指导下，做一个虔诚的基督徒！
Father Marian, forgive me for doubting you. We'll go and pray, and never again will we take anything to the mine!
神父马里安，原谅我之前对你的怀疑。我们会去祈祷，而且再也不会去矿井献祭了!
He's right, Father Marian. I saw the beast myself, and it certainly didn't look like him.
他是对的，神父马里安。我亲自看到了那只野兽，它肯定不长他这样。
Ambrose's brother Jan got what he deserved, just as the hermit wanted.
安布洛斯的弟弟约翰得到了他应得的安宁，正如那位隐士所希望的那样。
But not even a chamomile potion can fix everything. I'll have to treat you as well.
但即使是甘菊药剂也不能解决所有问题。我还得给你治疗。
But I have no idea what concoction would help Kozliek.
但我不知道用什么药剂能帮助科兹里克。
A potion for the pain or some chamomile should help with your leg.
止痛药或者甘菊药剂应该能治好你的腿。
Well, Kozliek, all I see are a few scratches. You'll be fine.
嗯，科兹里克，我只看到一些擦伤。你会没事的。
Hmm... You may not be dead, but you don't look all that great either, Kozliek.
嗯……你虽然没死，但看起来也不太好，科兹里克。
Bloody hell, Kozliek. That filthy bandage on your leg stinks worse than you do.
见鬼，科兹里克，你腿上的绷带比你还臭。
Well, Kozliek, it seems there's something wrong with your head, and that dirty bandage on your leg needs changing.
嗯，科兹里克，你的头部有问题，你腿上脏兮兮的绷带也该换了。
A healing concoction surely won't hurt him.
来点治疗药剂肯定有用。
A Buck's Blood potion would do you good, or at least some chamomile for you ankle.
你需要雄鹿之血药剂，或者至少给你的脚踝来点甘菊药剂。
You mean that nice girl who saved your life in the ruins of Skalitz?
你是说在斯卡里茨的废墟中救了你一命的那个好姑娘？
I was told by that… Henry of Skalitz!
是那个…斯卡里茨的亨利告诉我的！
I spoke to your assistant. His name is… Henry of Skalitz.
我和你的助手谈过了。他叫…斯卡里茨的亨利。
从…亨利那里听说的。斯卡里茨的亨利。
That filthy scrap of parchment described exactly where the chalice of Christ was hidden.
那张肮脏的羊皮纸准确描述了基督圣餐杯的藏匿地点。
I concocted a potion of invisibility, but it didn't work, just made me shi... er, feel poorly.
我调制了一种隐身药水，但它并不奏效，只是让我……呃，感觉不舒服。
Hmm, Skalitz, you say? That's where the royal mines are, am I right?
嗯，斯卡里茨？那里有皇室矿场，对不对？
Behold, Henry of Skalitz, who is truly not a noble!
看好了，这是斯卡里茨的亨利，他可不是贵族！
No way! Might as well crawl into the pillory myself in that case...
不可能！这样的话，我还不如自己进颈手枷呢…
It's just when you say “of Skalitz”, it has a noble ring to it.
你说“斯卡里茨”，这给人一种高贵的感觉。
Take a sword, a mace, whatever you fancy. But no bows or any of that shit.
带上一把剑，一把钉头锤，任何你喜欢的兵器。但不能带弓之类的。
Hare's an even bigger moron, old Alphabet.
黑尔就更是蠢货了，那个活化石。
And a hunting sword… my father used to have a beautiful one, I don't even know what happened to it. I wouldn't be ashamed of that one, but otherwise they're for fat burghers and poor mercenaries.
而猎刀……我的父亲曾有一把很漂亮的剑，而我甚至不知道它去哪了。拿着那个不会让我羞耻，但除此之外，这东西就是给发福的富人或是贫穷的雇佣兵用的。
And what about a cleaver? Or a hunting sword?
那么切肉刀呢？或者猎刀？
Greetings, Master Buresh. I'm Henry of Skalitz.
你好，布雷斯大人。我是斯卡里茨的亨利。
Damn it! Sorry, I don't have time for this.
该死！抱歉，我没时间陪你耗。
Gyönyörű? If someone said that to me, I'd think they were trying to insult me!
Gyönyöru（漂亮）？我听着怎么听起来像骂人！
How do you get on with those nomads up there?
你们和上面的游牧民关系如何？
I'm not a city lad, I'm from Skalitz.
我不是城里人，我是斯卡里茨人。
Have you heard of Skalitz? It was a nice little village.
你听过斯卡里茨吗？它曾是个很漂亮的小村庄。
Henry of Skalitz. Master Buresh sent me.
斯卡里茨的亨利。是布雷斯大人派我来的。
If you vanish right now, I'll pretend I never even saw you…
如果你现在消失，我就当没看见过你……
We sent them to the path around the pond. Not to the rocks, but along the other bank.
我们把他们送到了池塘那边的小路上。不是去山谷那边，而是沿着另一边河岸。
Now then… We drank together, but now I want to talk about Skalitz!
好了…我们一起喝了酒，现在我想谈谈关于斯卡里茨的事情！
That fucker Hare stole it from me and ran off!
那个混蛋黑尔从我这把它偷走，然后逃跑了！
From what I read I'd say someone gave Chertan Dollmaker potion. It weakens the body and slowly poisons you.
据我从书上看到的内容，有人给赫尔坦服用了玩偶毒药。这种毒会削弱身体并逐渐毒害你。
There's only one potion that kills that fast, in my opinion. And it's often mixed into food and drink. Bane.
我认为，只有一种药剂能这么快发挥致命的毒性，而且它经常被掺入饮食之中。它就是祸根毒药。
Maybe Chertan drank too much Lullaby potion. It works very fast, and it sometimes happens that people who drink too much of it…
也许赫尔坦喝下了过多的安眠毒药。这种药毒性很快就生效了，饮用过量的人有时会…
That ambush happened on the other side of the pond, so that's where you should be looking, not here. There's no one like that here.
伏击是在池塘的另一边，所以你应该去那里找，而不是这里。这里没有这样的人。
I'm certain you wouldn't want to find yourself in the pillory because you refused to answer a nobleman's question.
我敢肯定，你一定不希望自己因为拒绝回答一位贵族的问题而被套上颈手枷吧。
We were the ones who were ambushed yesterday by the pond. And Sir Hans isn't fit to travel now.
我们是昨天在池塘边被伏击的人。而且汉斯大人现在也不适合赶路。
But Chamberlain Ulrich himself sent me here.
不过，是管家乌尔里希本人派我来的。
Hare said he wanted to start his own gang, so I gave it to him.
黑尔说他想组织起自己的帮派，所以我就给了他。
If you want to find out more, there's a couple of guests having an ale over there.
如果你还想打听，那里就有几个受邀的宾客在喝酒。
At Semine, of course. I expect old Sir Jan and our bailiff will try to outdo each other in showing off their wealth.
当然是在塞米了。我估计扬大人和我们的执政官两位会较劲，大肆铺张显示各自的财力呢。
Old Jan Semine is the head of the family and his son's called Olda. And it's him who's getting hitched.
扬·塞米大人是一家之主，他的儿子叫奥达，就是他要结婚。
First you've got to carry them sacks for me, so don't bother looking anywhere else yet!
别忘了，你还得帮我搬面粉，不用急着去别的地方！
As you have already seen, the Sedletz Monastery is represented by Abbot Jan and the Brotherhood is represented by Konrad, the Pnewitz parish priest.
正如您已经看到的，塞德莱茨修道院的代表是修道院院长扬，兄弟会的代表是普内维茨的神父康拉德。
One of the men, Hare, brought a keg.
其中一个人，黑尔，带来了一桶酒。
Jan still thinks it'll be easy to capture von Bergow. But I heard what Adder said!
扬仍然认为抓住冯·波尔高会很容易。但我听到了阿德尔说的话！
Once a band of Praguers were causing trouble in the tavern, and we stepped in to break things up, they attacked us.
有一次，一帮布拉格士兵在酒馆里闹事，我们进去劝架，结果被他们打了。
It's a simple matter of money, so everyone here is fighting for the success of their side, almost to the blood.
简而言之，都是为了钱。每个人为了己方的利益，吵到几乎见血的地步。
Forget it! God knows where that cow's got to again! I ain't seen her all evening.
算了吧！谁知道那头母牛又跑到哪里去了！我整个晚上都没见到她。
Ne is mondd! A pokolba vele!
Ne is mondd! A pokolba vele!（别提这事了，这无所谓！）
I recently brought some Chamomile Brew to his bath to give him a compress on his eyes.
我最近给他洗澡时带了一些甘菊药剂，想给他敷一敷眼睛。
The Tachov folk have sheep aplenty, if you killed one they wouldn’t even notice!
那些塔科人养了很多羊，多到就算杀掉一只，他们也发现不了！
Certainly, sir. Go and see Lady Ophelia on the second floor. She'll take care of you.
当然可以，大人。去找三楼的奥菲利亚夫人。她会照顾好你的。
The driver wanted coin in exchange, but as soon as we pulled out the lute you got for us, and George and I played our beautiful…
车夫原本是要收钱的，但我们拿出了你给我们的鲁特琴，弹起了我们美妙的…
Abbot Jan hard, cannot be moved. Even Zbignev Hare the Archbishop Prague fail.
修道院院长扬铁石心肠、不为所动。就连布拉格大主教兹比格涅夫·黑尔也说不动他。
We're not von Bergow's men and we'll deal with him later. Like we did with you yesterday by the pond. But that's the least of your worries now.
我们不是冯·波尔高的人，我们晚点会再去对付他，就像我们昨天在池塘边对付你们那样。但现在你不需要操心这些了。
Lord von Bergow sent us to find the renegades who ambushed some knight's company down by the pond yesterday.
冯·波尔高大人派我们来寻找罪犯，他们昨天在池塘边伏击了某个骑士和随从们。
What rot! I'll make a pile of coin selling this game.
放屁！卖了这头猎物，我就能赚一大笔钱。
You mean since you and Jan Zizka escaped from Trosky?
你说的是自从你和扬·杰式卡从特罗斯基逃走以后吗？
Mi van? Fél tőlem? De én ezt nem akartam! Hát jó... Rendben, békén hagyom.
Mi van？Fél tolem？De én ezt nem akartam！Hát jó……Rendben，békén hagyom。
Igen? Aha, a fürdős lány. Miért ne? Minek ütöd bele az orrod. Igen, szeretem.
Igen？ Aha，a furdos lány.。Miért ne？Minek utod bele az orrod。Igen，szeretem。
Én, szerelmes. Ő hajadon. Nicht mann. Én erős. Ő szép. So schön...
Én，szerelmes。O hajadon。Nicht mann。Én eros。O szép。So schon……
Na, erről lehet szó. Akkor meg van beszélve. Békibe hagyom azt a nőszemélyt, jó? Érted? Keine frau! Igen!
Na，errol lehet szó。Akkor meg van beszélve，Békibe hagyom azt a noszemélyt，jó？ Érted？Keine frau! Igen！
Ne már! Ő az enyém, érted? Meine! Menj a francba!
Ne már！O az enyém，érted？Meine！Menj a francba！
His favourite girl disappear not long ago… Run away, I think. You know nomad: no home, always on road.
问题是，他的心上人最近失踪了…她肯定是走了。你知道那些游牧民的习性：居无定所，四海为家。
Strong, yes? This booze it make by nomads from up there. But no worry, only two men go blind so far!
很烈，对吧？这是山上的游牧民酿造的。但别担心，目前为止也就两个人喝这种酒喝到不省人事！
Hallod? Henry meg akarja szerezni neked azt a nőt!
Hallod? Henry meg akarja szerezni neked azt a not!（听到没？亨利想帮你把那女人搞到手！）
Szerelmes lettél, ugye!（你是不是爱上什么人了？）
Ugye, Jasak! Arra a nőre fened a fogad, mi?
Ugye, Jasak! Arra a nore fened a fogad, mi?（你已经等不及要吃掉她了吧？）
We were in Skalitz… And we leave because of what happened there!
是的，我们当时就在斯卡里茨…我们就是见不得那里的惨剧才逃走了！
It ain't going to be me who ends up in the pillory again, heheh!
最后再次被关到颈手枷里的人又不是我，呵呵！
But if you try anything funny...
I can see you shaking at the knees!
Don't move a muscle! Just wait till I'm done searching him, then you can take your turn.
别动！等我搜完他，就轮到你了。
Ta s'oda has? Avka pes ke tumende pro grai djal?
Ta s'oda has? Avka pes ke tumende pro grai djal?
What the hell was that? Is that how you ride where you're from?
What the hell was that? Is that how you ride where you're from?
I knew I made the right choice betting on you.
I knew I made the right choice betting on you.
Mi o Del tuke pro droma sitinel.
Mi o Del tuke pro droma sitinel.
You lost my money! I bet on you!
You lost my money! I bet on you!
You lost my money! I bet on you!
You lost my money! I bet on you!
Brilliant, brilliant! I knew why I wagered on you.
Brilliant, brilliant! I knew why I wagered on you.
Excellent! I trusted you. Perfect ride!
Excellent! I trusted you. Perfect ride!
To fuck up a race like that, you don't see that every day!
To fuck up a race like that, you don't see that every day!
To fuck up a race like that, you don't see that every day!
To fuck up a race like that, you don't see that every day!
Hoj tuke o kar te bandjol!
Hoj tuke o kar te bandjol!
The kalyi kahnyi anel parno yandro!
The kalyi kahnyi anel parno yandro!
The kalyi kahnyi anel parno yandro!
The kalyi kahnyi anel parno yandro!
Tu k-handuno kar! Te khas la dakeri mindj!
Tu k-handuno kar! Te khas la dakeri mindj!
Tu k-handuno kar! Te khas la dakeri mindj!
Tu k-handuno kar! Te khas la dakeri mindj!
Ha! Lache e e e e s!
Ha! Lache e e e e s!
Ha!- Lache e e e e s!
Ha!- Lache e e e e s!
Skalitz, he says... What a woeful prize that would have been.
斯卡里茨，他说…这奖励该会有多可悲啊。
And do you remember what you promised me?
你还记得自己答应过我什么吗？
Thanks. And if you ever need a blacksmith again…
谢谢。以后要是你还需要铁匠的话……
How was the race? How did you do with those horseshoes?
比赛如何？那套马蹄铁好不好用？
Stop your yelling. I can't help it that I'm a better rider than you.
别吼了。是我骑马技术比你强，这我也没办法。
Of course. Your share of the winnings. You've more than earned it.
当然，我答应了要分给你奖金，一分都少不了你的。
I didn't win anything, so I don't owe you anything. Get out of my sight!
我什么都没赢到，所以也不欠你的。走开！
You have the nerve to come to me? That was my race! I was supposed to win, not you!
你还有脸来找我？那场比赛明明是我计划好的！应该是我赢，不是你！
You should have seen it! My horse flew like the wind! Over grass, mud, even rocks.
你当时要是也在就好了！我的马跑得跟风一样快！不管草地上、泥地上、还是石头上，都不在话下。
I'll let you know, don't you worry.
We left all the others in the dust.
我把其他骑手都远远甩在了后面。
Bear in mind the times we're living in. King Wenceslas under lock and key in Vienna and his brother Sigismund meanwhile shamelessly plundering Bohemia.
当前局势不甚明朗。瓦茨拉夫国王被囚禁在维也纳，而他的兄弟西格斯蒙德在波希米亚横行霸道。
Jan! Damn it! What good is revenge if they kill us?!
扬！他妈的！如果他们杀了我们，还怎么复仇？
Jesus! What kind of butcher are you?
Nice strike, fucker! My turn now!
打得不错，混蛋！现在轮到我了！
Over here! Quick, before he kills me!
We've got some master swordsman here!
看来这儿有位剑术高手！
一个将死之人，打得还不赖！
Help me with him, for fuck's sake!
看在老天的份上，帮我揍他！
There'll be some fun with this one!
This is a tough one, fellahs!
Don't try that on me, you cocksucker!
别想用这招对付我，你个混蛋！
You'll have to do better than that!
I'll pay you back for that, you shit!
That's not going to help you!
Uff ... Du bist so gut wie tot.
Uff ... Du bist so gut wie tot. （嗯…你死定了。）
Uff, ich bring dich um, du Mistkerl.
Uff, ich bring dich um, du Mistkerl. （呼，这就宰了你个废物。）
Uff ... mein Gott! Du verdammter …(呼…我靠！你这该死的…)
What are you up to? Not only do you cosy up to them nomads, but you take me for a fool too? At him, lads!
你在搞什么？你不仅讨好那些游牧民，还将我当成傻子了吗？兄弟们，收拾他！
Pay for a dead nomad? You must be out of your mind! But suit yourself, let's see your coin.
为一个死掉的游牧民花钱？你肯定是疯了吧！但是随你便，给我看看你的钱。
The foreman said we should tie the body to a tree. So's them other vagabonds see they can't mess with us.
领班说我们应该把尸体绑在树上，让其他游牧民看看，我们不是好惹的。
Try them fairy tales on the nomads' brats! Now fuck off, or it'll be the worse for you!
拿着你的童话故事去骗骗游牧民的孩子们吧！现在给我滚，否则你会后悔的！
I've come for Gejza, the son of the nomads' Voivode. Or rather… for his body.
我是来找盖萨的，游牧民司令官的儿子，或者是说来要…他的尸体。
That dead nomad… I'd like to take him away.
那个死掉的游牧民……我想把他带走。
You've got the body of a dead nomad here…
你这里有一具游牧民的尸体…
And if I hear about anyone causing trouble again, I'll have you all clapped in the pillory! Together!
如果我再听到有人闹事，我就把你们拷上颈手枷！一个不落！
Let this be a lesson to you that you should never mess around with moonshine.
你要吸取教训，永远不要胡乱尝试私酒。
Fine, I'll tell you about the first time I tried moonshine...
好吧，我跟你讲讲我第一次尝试私酒的故事…
斯卡里茨的亨利“快如风”。
You should've seen me when I rode from Skalitz! I was riding so fast, none of those bloody fucking Cum…
你们真该看看我在斯卡里茨策马扬鞭的样子！我骑马的速度太快了，那些该死的库曼…
Azt mondja, ő úszik a legjobban.
Azt mondja, o úszik a legjobban.（他说他最擅长游泳。）
Pah, it is just talk! Pisilni a szélben - pissing in the wind.
哈！光说不练顶个屁用！Pisilni a szélben，白费口舌。
Not like fucking lazy cats. If you in trouble they only watch.
不像那些懒惰的猫，甚至不肯动动爪子来帮你一下…
Oh, bazmeg! What they put in this booze? I never see nothing like!
啊！Bazmeg（操）！他们在这些酒里都放了什么？我从来没喝过这种东西！
I'm Henry of Skalitz. Master Nicholas from Prague sent me to train young Master Hendl in swordfighting.
我是斯卡里茨的亨利。布拉格的尼古拉斯大师派我来为亨德尔少主训练剑术。
I'm Henry of Skalitz. Master Menhard from Frankfurt sent me to train young Master Hendl in swordfighting.
我是斯卡里茨的亨利。法兰克福的门哈德大师派我来为亨德尔少主训练剑术。
But you can use a mace, flail or hunting sword.
但你可以使用钉头锤、连枷或猎刀。
I had a bit of a quarrel with Sir Jan of Lesztin and I need someone young and strong to take my place in a duel.
我和莱斯廷的扬爵士发生了点纠纷，我需要一个年轻力壮的人替我决斗。
You know, lad… Under all the armour and finery you will only ever find a man.
小伙子，你得知道……所有的盔甲和华服之下都只是一个凡人。
And now I stand at his kingdom's gate at last…
现在我终于抵达了他天国的门前……
Eh… But you are right about one thing… Sigismund is not perfect either… Neither brother takes after their father.
呃…… 不过有一点你说得没错…… 西吉斯蒙德也并非完人…… 兄弟俩都不像父亲。
I suppose he loved her like he loves this country.
我想他怎样爱他的妻子，就会怎样爱这个国家。
I feel regret at leaving my family, but I am consoled that I did the best for them and Sigismund will take care of them when he becomes king…
我很遗憾离开了我的家人。但我可以欣慰地说我为他们做好了能做的一切。西格斯蒙德当上国王后会照顾他们的……
Do not show your back to "allies" like him too often, Henry of Skalitz.
不要把后背漏给他这样的“盟友”，斯卡里茨的亨利。
… I fought for what I believed in.
My sins are washed away, lad.
我的罪孽已经洗清了，小伙子。
A whoremonger and a drunk who does to this country what he did to his wife?
那个荒淫无度、只会饮酒做乐，亲手毁灭了自己的妻子与国家的人？
You know a lot for a blacksmith's son… But tell me… Why did Wenceslas go hunting instead of going to the funeral? With the same dog…
作为一个铁匠的儿子你知道得很多嘛……那我问你……为什么瓦茨拉夫不去参加葬礼？而是带着那条狗去打猎？
And for that I apologise to you… and to God.
我为此向你道歉……也向上帝忏悔。
If you're going to look for him, Hungary is where I would start.
如果你要找他，恐怕得去匈牙利喽。
You got this far by yourself, by yourself you must continue.
你都能自己闯到这来了，自然也能自己找到马厩。
The only thing that torments me now is that I am leaving my family.
我唯一放不下的事情，就是再也看不到家人了。
Wenceslas is not interested in being king and Sigismund tries to win Bohemians' love by spilling their blood…
瓦茨拉夫无心治理国家，西格斯蒙德则为波希米亚人带来战争而又想赢得他们的拥戴……
In the king who got us into this?
为了那个导致现在这一切的国王吗？
In a whoremonger… a layabout and a drunk who had his wife torn apart by dogs?
一个荒淫无度、怠于政事……能让狗撕碎妻子的酒鬼？
Let him find out! I've got the certificate and nothing can change that!
那就让他发现好了！反正我有官方许可了，没有人能改变这点！
My door is always open for you.
And who have the prettiest arses to slap!
而且这有最靓的屁股可以拍！
I've got enough to keep the place going till winter. But that's not your problem.
我有足够的东西撑到冬天，但这部分你就不用操心了。
He's been bribing the council for years now, so why should it matter if I swing the balance in my favour for once?!
他多年来一直在贿赂市议会，所以这次我影响一下局势又有何妨呢？
Laying a hand on family! Shame on you!
Even after all you've done, you still invoke God's grace…
你做了这么多肮脏事，还想祈求上帝的恩典……
You said it doesn't matter how many people I kill, because I can never change what happened.
您说过无论我杀多少人，都无法改变已经发生的事实。
And you also asked if I feel better. To tell the truth… no, I don't.
您还问过我是否感觉好点了。说实话……没有，一点都不好。
You believed you'd restore order by killing people?
你相信靠杀人就能够恢复秩序？
It still haunts me, but what could I do?
这事仍然困扰着我，但我能怎么办呢？
It still haunts me, but what could I do?
这事仍然困扰着我，但我能怎么办呢？
Look… I can't kill him. He's old and not long for this world. It seems truly bad to me.
听着……我下不了手。他已经老了，时日不多了。我真的觉得这样做很不好。
我懂，就让这件事过去吧。
Jobst is trying to mend the damage Sigismund and his lackeys have done!
约布斯特只是试图挽救西格斯蒙德和他的走狗们造成的灾难！
Maleshov, Semine? Innocent people shouldn't have to die. I'm glad I found the courage to defy orders.
马列索夫，塞米？无辜之人不该死。很庆幸我为此敢违抗命令。
Maleshov, Semine? Innocent people shouldn't have to die. I'm glad I found the courage to defy orders.
马列索夫，塞米？无辜之人不该死。很庆幸我为此敢违抗命令。
Should I have sat back and done nothing after everything that happened?
在发生了这一切之后，难道我还该袖手旁观、什么都不做吗？
I'm sorry. It would never have happened if I wasn't in such a bind.
抱歉，当时事态紧急，不然我也不会这么做。
I'm sorry. It would never have happened if I wasn't in such a bind.
抱歉，当时事态紧急，不然我也不会这么做。
I'm sorry. I had to decide whether to risk many lives to save one.
抱歉。但选择救他就得牺牲很多人。
I'm sorry. I had to decide whether to risk many lives to save one.
抱歉。但选择救他就得牺牲很多人。
I thought I was doing the right thing, but people still died… My people.
我以为我是对的，但还是有人为此送命……我的同伴。
I thought I was doing the right thing, but people still died… My people.
我以为我是对的，但还是有人为此送命……我的同伴。
We may have won in the end, but the road to victory was hard.
最终算是赢了，但一路走来付出的代价也很惨重。
Don't worry. I won't forget him either.
So what? I have no regrets! What do those yokels matter? Why should I feel sorry for them?
那又怎样？我问心无愧！那些乡巴佬算什么东西？我为什么要同情他们？
So what? I have no regrets! What do those yokels matter? Why should I feel sorry for them?
那又怎样？我问心无愧！那些乡巴佬算什么东西？我为什么要同情他们？
You said it didn't matter how many people I killed - I could never change what happened.
您说过无论我杀多少人，都无法改变已经发生的事实。
You said it didn't matter how many people I killed - I could never change what happened.
您说过无论我杀多少人，都无法改变已经发生的事实。
Those words guided me. I didn't kill. And maybe I do feel better now.
这些话指引了我，我没有杀人，也许现在我的确感觉好点了。
Those words guided me. And maybe I do feel better now.
这些话指引了我，也许现在我的确感觉好点了。
Pity it had to end this way.
可惜最后是以这种方式收场。
You wear the mark of a criminal, like an animal! And no wonder, the way you behaved.
你身上打下了罪犯的烙印，就像头牲畜一样！ 也难怪会这样，瞧瞧你之前的所作所为。
So you gave him death. A merciless and cruel death.
所以你就选择杀了他。无情、残忍地结束了他的性命。
You did wrong, but maybe you've made amends for your sins.
你确实做错了事，但我想你已经改过自新。
Alright. You avenged an evil act, but you behaved like a bandit, plundering and robbing poor wretches… Oh, my son.
你报复了恶行，这不假，但你也像一个强盗一样四处掠夺、抢劫穷人……哦，我的孩子。
Alright. You avenged an evil act, but you behaved like a bandit, plundering and robbing the poor. Oh, my son.
你报复了恶行，这不假，但你也像一个强盗一样四处掠夺、抢劫穷人。哦，我的孩子。

你报复了恶行，这不假，但你也像一个强盗一样四处掠夺、抢劫穷人。哦，我的孩子……
I hope you'll be happy with her.
我希望你和她过得幸福。
I hope you'll be happy with her.
我希望你和她过得幸福。
You should hope the Almighty will understand... and give you a chance to make amends.
你应该祈求全能的主能够理解……并给你改过自新的机会。
You should hope the Almighty will understand... and give you a chance to make amends.
你应该祈求全能的主能够理解……并给你改过自新的机会。
Once you set off down the path of revenge, Henry, I thought you'd keep going to the very end.
亨利，当初你踏上了复仇之路，我原以为你会一路走到底，直至最终。
You wear the mark of a criminal, like an animal! And no wonder, the way you behaved.
你身上打下了罪犯的烙印，就像头牲畜一样！ 也难怪会这样，瞧瞧你之前的所作所为。
You should have killed them all!
你就应该把他们全都杀了！
You helped save the country, but you don't have many friends in these parts…
你帮忙拯救了这个国家，但却形单影只……
You helped save the country, but you don't have many friends in these parts…
你帮忙拯救了这个国家，但却形单影只……
Sorry… I just don't think you can turn the other cheek to evil.
抱歉……我只是觉得你就不应该对恶人还宽容忍让。
Ask your conscience if you did the right thing.
摸着自己的良心问问，所做的事情是否正确吧。
Watch out for that Erik. I don't think he's going to forget you anytime soon.
要小心那个埃里克。他不会轻易放过你的。
Watch out for that Erik. I don't think he's going to forget you anytime soon.
要小心那个埃里克。他不会轻易放过你的。
Well, it's time to say goodbye...
Well, it's time to say goodbye...
I hoped you wouldn't make the same mistakes as me. But I suppose it's the times you live in.
我曾希望你不会重蹈我的覆辙。但想来这也是你所处的时代所致吧。
I hoped you wouldn't make the same mistakes as me. But I suppose it's the times you live in.
我曾希望你不会重蹈我的覆辙。但想来这也是你所处的时代所致吧。
But sometimes it's better not to play by their rules.
但有时候最好不要遵循他们的处世之道。
Nothing's black and white. Sometimes you have to make tough decisions in life. And God alone can judge whether you made the right ones.
世事并非黑白分明。有时候你不得不做出艰难的抉择。只有上帝能评判你的对错。
Nothing's black and white. Sometimes you have to make tough decisions in life. And God alone can judge whether you made the right ones.
世事并非黑白分明。有时候你不得不做出艰难的抉择。只有上帝能评判你的对错。
Well, whichever way your path leads, take my advice.
嗯，不管你要走向何方，不妨记住我的建议。
Well, whichever way your path leads, take my advice.
嗯，不管你要走向何方，不妨记住我的建议。
Because I didn't know. I just had an inkling... They took Sarah away on account of me and I had no idea where to look for her.
因为我当时也不知道，只是有一点印象……他们因为我而带走了莎拉，我不知道该去哪找她。
Because I didn't know. I just had an inkling... They took Sarah away on account of me and I had no idea where to look for her.
因为我当时也不知道，只是有一点印象……他们因为我而带走了莎拉，我不知道该去哪找她。
You mustn't blame yourself for that.
But what with my darling wife pocketing all my coin, I ended up in the pillory.
但由于我的妻子卷走了我所有的钱财，我最后被关在了颈手枷里。
I ain't seen you here before. Who sent you? Not them nomad vagabonds, I hope?
我之前没见过你，谁派你来的？该不会是那帮游牧民吧？
So I don't forget, Henry, Mikesh said he and Kozliek would like to repay their debt to you. So tell me where to put them.
亨利，米凯什说他和科兹里克想要偿还欠你的人情。告诉我把他们安排在哪里，以免我忘记了。
In this final duel, Henry of Skalitz earned the fifth victory for the Frankfurt brotherhood!
在最后一场决斗中，斯卡里茨的亨利为法兰克福兄弟会赢了第五局！
Show me what you're carrying, or I'll haul you straight to the pillory!
让我看看你拿的是什么，否则我就把你关进颈手枷！
But please come and tell me how it turned out. I'll make it worth your while.
但请你过来告诉我结果。我不会让你白跑一趟的。
Ja, das ist alles.（是的，只有这些了。）
You bet he does. His housekeeper told me he's got a broach at home I lost a month ago.
当然了。他的管家告诉我，他家里有一枚我一个月前弄丢的别针。
Clap them in the pillory I say! They'll think twice next time!
要我说，把他们关进颈手枷！他们下次会三思而后行！
Not a chance, that old coot will outlive us all. No, it was Jan, the beanpole.
不可能，那老家伙可能比我们都还长命呢。不，是“瘦竹竿”扬。
Those hose shouldn't be too loose, but not too tight either.
衬裤不能太松，但也不能太紧。
Good old cabbage… I cannot get enough of it! Lecker und gesund!
美味的卷心菜…我吃不够！有益健康！
No. If meine Frau saw you, gibt’s nur Ärger.
不，要是被 meine Frau （我的夫人）看到的话, gibt’s nur Ärger（麻烦就大了）.
Hmm ... verdammt hochnäsig.（嗯……那个鼻子朝天的人又回来了。）
So wie immer also.（唉，狗改不了吃屎。）
Ja, kein Geld, but a name as long as a Schwachkopf.
是的，没有钱，但名字像个白痴一样长。
Me? I was at the tavern with some friends, and this Schnösel was causing a scene.
我？我当时正和一些朋友在酒馆，这个自命不凡的人正在吵闹。
Johann went to him and asked him to calm down. And the Schnösel started yelling, saying how dare he speak to a noble like that.
约翰走到他身边，让他冷静一下。那个自命不凡的人开始大喊大叫，说他怎么敢这样对一个贵族说话。
Pff, von Nassenbart? More like von Nackterarsch!
呸，冯·纳森巴特？我看是冯·光屁股！
Natürlich, but he said I offended him, and he wanted a duel.
当然，但他说我冒犯了他，他要决斗。
So I said to myself: nomen est omen, and poured wine on his head.
于是我心想：真是人如其名，然后把酒倒在他头上。
Vagy valami kretén, aki inkább megöleti magát, de egy garast sem adna ki a kezéből.
Vagy valami kretén, aki inkább megoleti magát, de egy garast sem adna ki a kezébol.
Öregem, rohadtul nyom ez a cipő!
oregem, rohadtul nyom ez a cipo!
Higgyél, de azért mindig ellenőrizd a dolgokat. Ahogy a papunk mondogatta, amikor gyerek voltam.
Higgyél, de azért mindig ellenorizd a dolgokat. Ahogy a papunk mondogatta, amikor gyerek voltam.
Hehe, ez rájuk vall. A bőrt is lenyúzzák az emberről.
Hehe, ez rájuk vall. A bort is lenyúzzák az emberrol.
Mint amikor lecsaptunk azokra a bányászokra, de mielőtt begyűjthettük volna a suskát, megjelent az a rohadék lovag.
Mint amikor lecsaptunk azokra a bányászokra, de mielott begyujthettuk volna a suskát, megjelent az a rohadék lovag.
Tudom, de mit csináljak, ha hallom őket?
Tudom, de mit csináljak, ha hallom oket?
Hát én tehetek róla, hogy pont egy heringkereskedőt evett erre a fene? Csak nem hagyjuk kárba veszni!
Hát én tehetek róla, hogy pont egy heringkereskedot evett erre a fene? Csak nem hagyjuk kárba veszni!
Nagyon. És szőkék voltak és fátylat viseltek.
Nagyon. És szokék voltak és fátylat viseltek.
Mi? Bakkecskéket?! Hangról meg tudod különbözteti a bakkecskét a gödölyétől? És lánccsörgést nem hallottál?
Mi? Bakkecskéket?! Hangról meg tudod kulonbozteti a bakkecskét a godolyétol? És lánccsorgést nem hallottál?
Először a gatyájából potyogott a kincs, aztán meg a bukszájából szórta az ezüstöket!
Eloszor a gatyájából potyogott a kincs, aztán meg a bukszájából szórta az ezustoket!
Where do you think? At the mill. I was there with Paka and Yura to sell some goods we picked up at the ford that time.
还能是哪里？在磨坊。我当时和帕卡、汝拉一起去卖我们在渡口捡到的东西。
Aztán egyik a másik után elkezdtek felfújódni és szétpukkantak. És apám, egy csomó arany szóródott ki belőlük.
Aztán egyik a másik után elkezdtek felfújódni és szétpukkantak. És apám, egy csomó arany szóródott ki beloluk.
Hát pont ez az, a várakozás! Bámulsz ki a fejedből és azon görcsölsz, hogy nem téved-e erre egy csapat zsandár.
Hát pont ez az, a várakozás! Bámulsz ki a fejedbol és azon gorcsolsz, hogy nem téved-e erre egy csapat zsandár.
Apátok lapát... de ha már a böjtölésről volt szó, hallottam egy jót.
Apátok lapát... de ha már a bojtolésrol volt szó, hallottam egy jót.
Na, ez az! Ott hallgattad azt az őrült prédikátort, aki a pokol tüzéről meg a kénköves bugyrokról hadovált.
Na, ez az! Ott hallgattad azt az orult prédikátort, aki a pokol tuzérol meg a kénkoves bugyrokról hadovált.
A pokolba is, csak egyszer fordult elő, de neked mindig az orrom alá kell dörgölnöd!
A pokolba is, csak egyszer fordult elo, de neked mindig az orrom alá kell dorgolnod!
Az erdőben voltam és egyszerre csak gyönyörű ének üti meg a fülemet. Tisztára mint az angyalok kara.
Az erdoben voltam és egyszerre csak gyonyoru ének uti meg a fulemet. Tisztára mint az angyalok kara.
Úgyhogy feltöltette a kolostor pincéjét bokáig érő vízzel, és levitetett oda pár disznót.
Úgyhogy feltoltette a kolostor pincéjét bokáig éro vízzel, és levitetett oda pár disznót.
Bokáig érő vízben nem lehet megfulladni. Meg különben is, nekünk régen volt otthon disznónk, amikor kicsi voltam.
Bokáig éro vízben nem lehet megfulladni. Meg kulonben is, nekunk régen volt otthon disznónk, amikor kicsi voltam.
Ez bazmeg tisztára te vagy. Ahelyett, hogy begyűjtenéd a szajrét, csak állsz és faszságokon töröd a fejed.
Ez bazmeg tisztára te vagy. Ahelyett, hogy begyujtenéd a szajrét, csak állsz és faszságokon töröd a fejed.
Te? Mire mennének veled ott? Hacsak nem madárijesztő kéne nekik a veteményesbe.
Te? Mire mennének veled ott? Hacsak nem madárijeszto kéne nekik a veteményesbe.
Már megint? Dejszen egész mostanáig húztad a lóbőrt!
Már megint? Dejszen egész mostanáig húztad a lóbort!
De belőled aztán biztos apátot csináltak volna, te gyönyörűség.
De beloled aztán biztos apátot csináltak volna, te gyonyoruség.
Well, like Cumans or nomads hanging around…
嗯，比如库曼人或游牧民在附近游荡…
I heard the nomads will be joined by others soon.
听说那群游牧民很快就会跟其它人搭伙了。
Those bloody nomads… Just what we needed!
那些该死的游牧民…要他们好看！
Ármin meg Gysel ott voltak, ők mindent tanúsítanak...
Ármin meg Gysel ott voltak, ok mindent tanúsítanak...
A faszomba, hát mondom, hogy nincs pénzem. Menj el Grozavhoz vagy Chertanhoz, és vedd rá őket, hogy fizessék ki a zsoldunkat...
A faszomba, hát mondom, hogy nincs pénzem. Menj el Grozavhoz vagy Chertanhoz, és vedd rá oket, hogy fizessék ki a zsoldunkat...
Come, goodman. I'll fix up that mane of yours so well, you'll be sure to impress Lady Anna herself!
来吧，朋友。我会把你的头发剪得漂漂亮亮，保证让安娜夫人都对你刮目相看！
It looks like you have some arse hair stuck to your lip.
看你嘴唇上，像沾了些屁股毛似的。
For Christ's sake, is it really so hard to wash up before marching in here?
老天啊，来这里之前洗个澡有那么难吗？
Very funny, but I don't shave below the belt, got it?
别逗了，但我可不刮腰部以下的毛，明白吗？
Have a seat. When I'm done with you, you'll be the talk of the town!
坐下吧。等我给你剪完，你肯定会成为全城热议的话题！
If you hurl, I'll charge you double, got it?
要是你吐了，我可得加倍收费，明白了吗？
Seems you've lost a bit of blood. Or is it the other bloke's?
你这身上是自己流的血，还是你对手的？
Bloody hell, lad. It'd be a shame to waste my skills on you.
见鬼了，小伙子。把我的手艺浪费在你身上真是太可惜了。
My services are only for decent folks.
我这里只为正经人服务。
You're just in time! I just sharpened my scissors.
你来得正好！我刚磨好了剪刀。
I had a fellow from Nürnberg here recently, so I can give you the imperial style if you'd like.
我最近接待过一位纽伦堡的客人，如果你愿意，我可以给你剪个皇家风格的发型。
I'm not judging, but don't blame me if you catch a cold.
我不是想说你什么，但你要是感冒了可别赖我。
I'm afraid not even my skills will be enough to help you.
恐怕就连我的手艺也帮不了你了。
A well-groomed beard is a sign of decorum, an unkempt one is a sign of laziness.
整洁的胡须是礼貌的象征，邋遢的胡须是懒惰的标志。
Forgive me the honesty, but you smell like an unwashed arse.
别介意我直说啊，你闻起来简直像没洗过的屁股。
Don't come around here with that brand on your neck, or my razor just might slip.
别带着脖子上的烙印来这里，否则我的剃刀可能会滑手。
For a handsome fellow like yourself, it'd be a sin not to get a fresh haircut.
像你这样英俊的小伙子，不剪个新发型简直是罪过。
The girls must have really spun your head around if you forgot to put your clothes on!
你肯定被姑娘们迷得晕头转向了，不然怎么连衣服都忘了穿！
Eh, Was ist los?（诶，你还好吗？）
What brauchst du, Fremder？（需要点什么，陌生人？）
Was möchtest du, mein Herr?（你想买什么，先生？）
Was möchtest du, mein Freund?（想买点什么，朋友？）
Was willst du, du Schuft?（你想干什么，混蛋？）
Was willst du, Bastard?（想要什么，混蛋？）

Was darf's sein heute Morgen?（早安，想买点什么？）

Wie geht es dir so, Heinrich?
Wie geht es dir so, Heinrich?（你怎么样，亨利？）
Wie geht's, mein Freund?（你好吗，我的朋友？）

Wie geht's, mein Freund?（你好吗，我的朋友？）
