I really like the look of Svadilfari, but that price can't be right.
我真喜欢斯瓦迪尔法利的卖相，但价格不太满意。
The price for Kasztanka seems a bit high. Let's talk about it.
栗的价格似乎有点高了。我们再谈谈吧。
斯瓦迪尔法利？这是一匹怎样的马？
With a name like Kincsem, I reckon she's not from here, eh?
从金克森姆这个名字来看，它应该不是本地马，对吗？
Windwurf looks good, but I had a different price in mind.
飓风看起来很好，但是能不能再便宜一点。
I'll be happy to pay you what you ask for Windwurf.
我很乐意按照你的出价买下飓风。
我要那匹母马——金克森姆。
You wouldn't be able to manage with Veillantif and another horse anyway.
你一个人肯定无法同时管理韦兰迪夫和另一匹马。
Some scoundrel tried stealing one of our other horses once. As soon as Veillantif saw, he ran straight over.
有个混蛋想偷我们另外一匹马，被韦兰迪夫瞧见了，它就径直跑了过去。
That handful of alms for Veillantif? You should be ashamed…
想用那点钱买下韦兰迪夫？不嫌丢人吗…
I reckon they sold poor Bill so they could buy a hot dinner. I mean, they couldn't even afford shoes…
我想他们卖掉比尔是为了换一顿热餐。我是说，他们甚至连鞋子都买不起了…
He needed a warhorse - and Kincsem certainly isn't that.
他需要一匹战马——而金克森姆当然不是那种马。
But to tell you the truth, Kasztanka is a gentle horse, definitely not a hero.
但实话告诉你，栗是温驯的马，并不是好斗的战马。
Alright, I'll let you have Kasztanka for that much.
好吧。就按这个价钱把栗带走吧。
It's no exaggeration to say that Windwurf's forebears built Grund.
毫不夸张地说，飓风的祖先曾经参与建立格兰德。
As far as I now, one of Windwurf's brothers turns wheels in some Kuklitz mine, and he's happy enough.
据我所知，飓风的一个兄弟在库克利茨的某个矿山工作，它过得挺满足的。
It ain't far from Zhelejov to Semine. Sir Jan, the owner, he got a big stud farm with fine horses, and down by the water a mill.
从哲勒约夫到塞米并不远。那里的领主扬大人有一个很大的种马场，他养了好几匹骏马，靠近水边还有一个磨坊。
A miner has to make some money, right?
矿工总能赚点钱的，你说是吧？
That's the biggest thing happening. Apart from that, a band of nomads turned up here. They got a camp somewhere down by the pond.
这就是最近的大事了。除此以外，还有一队游牧民来了这里。他们在池塘边的某个地方扎营。
Sir Hans Capon of Pirkstein, and Henry of Skalitz.
皮克斯坦因的汉斯·卡蓬爵士，和斯卡里茨的亨利。
Jan of Semine was a traitor. He deserved nothing less!
塞米的扬是叛徒，他该死！
We wanted to arrest that rebel, but his father, Jan, wouldn't give him up peacefully. Unfortunately.
我们想逮捕那个叛军，但他父亲，扬，迟迟不愿交出人。很遗憾。
When you take a mace in your hand, a nice chunk of metal, you know one good blow will do the job.
手上有钉头锤这等千斤铁块，只需朝前挥一下，事情就解决了。
It's true. Women do wear too much, and for no good reason.
是的。她们的穿着的确太讲究了，反正我也不太懂。
My g-goal? You… You mean the moonshine?
我的目-目标？你…你是说私酒吗？
I thought you and Kozliek would help us.
我还以为你和科兹里克会帮助我们。
There… there was no other way.
Fuck! Let's not talk about that fucker anymore! It just gets me mad! But we'll get him back one day!
妈的！我们不要再谈这个了！这让我又开始愤怒了！总有一天我会抓到他的！
És mi van az étellel? Eh…
És mi van az étellel? Eh…（那些吃的怎么办？呃……）
Jobb, ha megyünk, vagy megütöm.（还是快走吧，不然我的拳头就不听使唤了。）
Mit akarsz te disznó?（想干什么？你们这帮畜生。）
Barely! They are so covered up in clothes it is like talking to a pile of laundry!
没怎么见过！你知道的，捷克姑娘都被一层层衣服遮住了!
Calm down, Jan. We're still friends.
冷静点，扬。我们还是朋友。
Theresa. She lived with that crook Peshek at the mill.
特丽莎。她和皮社科住在磨坊。
I'm also entrusting to you my man-at-arms Kozliek and one of the local men.
我还会派我的武侍科兹里克和一名本地士兵跟着你。
You dance like a fairy, Doubravka.
你跳起舞像精灵一样优雅，杜布拉娃。
She was with child. I reckon she was carrying Jan's bastard, and Von Bergow was against it.
她有了身孕。我猜测她怀的是扬的私生子，冯·波尔高对此很不满。
The lass couldn't have been older than fifteen. A servant at the castle. I saw young Sir Jan being dragged away from her.
那个女孩不足十五岁。是城堡里的佣人。我看到有人把年轻的扬爵士从她身边拉开。
Hé! Fordítsd meg a kancád, és tűnés!
Hé! Fordítsd meg a kancád, és tunés!
Tartsd meg hülyeségeidet és tűnj el!
Tartsd meg hülyeségeidet és tunj el!
Már megint ideevett a fene?! Fordítsd meg a gebéd és tűnés!
Már megint ideevett a fene?! Fordítsd meg a gebéd és tunés!
My name is Henry of Skalitz. Our family rented a mine, so I came to gain experience.
我是斯卡里茨的亨利，我家租了一个矿场，我是来积累经验的。
And Rat told you I know where to sell this stuff?
老鼠和你说过我知道在哪里能卖掉这东西？
And it's also true that we were ambushed yesterday down by the pond.
而且我们昨天在池塘边遭到伏击也是真的。
We were heading to Trosky to deliver a message from Sir Hanush of Leipa and Margrave Jobst to Lord von Bergow, but we were ambushed by bandits yesterday down by the pond.
我们要去特罗斯基，把莱佩的瀚纳什爵士和约布斯特侯爵的信息传递给冯·波尔高大人，但我们昨天在池塘边遭到强盗的伏击。
Fuck, quickly! For the love of God, sort out this rabble before they turn everything into firewood!
妈的，上帝啊！快把他们赶出去，不然这地方都要被砸烂了！
I expect you're Peter of Pisek? I am Jan Zizka of Trotznov.
你是皮塞克的彼得吧？我是特罗茨诺夫的扬·杰式卡。
Mishtes, gadjo, mishtes（朋友们，外来人，朋友们）……
Ne pazaroljátok az időt azzal a kibaszott paraszttal!
Ne pazaroljátok az idot azzal a kibaszott paraszttal（别跟那个乡巴佬浪费时间）!
Hajtsátok ki oket! Mindenkit（都拖出去！一个都别放过）!
Wait! Aren't you that robber baron from Apollonia? What are you doing here?
等等！你不就是那个阿波罗尼亚的贵族强盗吗？你在这里做什么？
Du hast Glück, ich wollte gerade schließen.
Du hast Glück, ich wollte gerade schließen.（来得正好，我正准备打烊了。）
Fort, du Bettler!（滚蛋，你这乞丐！）
Guten Tag, mein Herr.（你好，先生。）
Guten Tag, mein Freund!（你好，我的朋友！）
Ich bin gleich bei dir …（我马上来……）
Sei gegrüßt, mein Herr.（您好，先生。）
Raus mit dir, Säufer!（滚出去，你这酒鬼！）
Raus, du Bastard!（给我滚，你这混蛋！）
Schön, dich zu sehen.（好久不见。）
Verdammter Regen, oder?（这雨下得可真够烦人的，你说是吧？）
Such dir was aus …（随便看看吧……）
Was ist los? Du blutest.（出什么事了，你浑身是血。）
今天的雨下得真大，是吧？
Du hast Glück, ich wollte gerade schließen.
Du hast Glück, ich wollte gerade schließen. （运气不错，我马上就要关门了。）
Hau ab, du Bettler!（哪凉快哪呆着去，乞丐！）
Guten Tag, mein Herr.（你好，先生。）
Ich bin gleich bei dir…（我马上就来……）
Sei gegrüßt, mein Herr.（您好，先生。）
Raus mit dir, Säufer!（滚出去，你这酒鬼！）
Raus, du Bastard!（给我滚，你这混蛋！）
Schön, dich zu sehen.（好久不见。）
Guten Tag, mein Freund!（你好，我的朋友！）
Verdammter Regen, oder?（这雨下得可真够烦人的，你说是吧？）
Such dir was aus …（随便看看吧……）
Was machst du, du blutest?（怎么一身的血？）
Willkommen, mein Freund!（欢迎光临，我的朋友！）
Es reicht!（已经够了！）我不打了！
Now that's what I call an opener!
这就是我所说的华丽开场！
And you'll get another right away!
You won't be able to take another one like that!
Ha, ich hab dich! （哈！你跑不掉了！）
Wie gefällt dir das? （你很享受啊，对吧？）
Think you can face me, do you? Ha!
你以为能打得过我吗？哈！
You can't stand up to this!
Pech gehabt, Arschloch. （倒霉了吧，混账）
It's a wonder you're still standing!
你还能站着，真是个奇迹！
Now that's what I call an opener!
这就是我所说的华丽开场！
See, you shit? You're no match for me!
看到了吧，狗屎？你根本不是我的对手！
I wouldn't be so sure about that.
So, what happened back in Skalitz? Did you fall back there too, warrior?
那么，在斯卡里茨时发生了什么？战士，你在那里也退缩了吗？
You don't say! Then why does Chamberlain Ulrich suspect you personally?
真的吗？那么管家乌尔里希为何要怀疑你呢？
After Skalitz, right? You were there.
在斯卡里茨，对吗？你当时在场…
I tell you about Skalitz… But not now.
我会和你谈谈斯卡里茨的事情…但不是现在…
Minden elől elszökhetsz, csak a múltad elől nem.
Minden elol elszokhetsz, csak a múltad elol nem.（我们可以逃过一切，却逃不出自己的过往。）
斯卡里茨？你怎么…你什么知道那件事？
So what are we waiting for? On y va!
那我们还等什么呢？走吧！
Hold on a bit. Before we hit the road, there's something you should know. I have a hunch that one of that band that ambushed us at the pond was…
等会。在我们上路之前，有件事你应该知道。我的直觉告诉我在池塘边伏击我们的那些人中，有一个人是……
Simply... It was just like Skalitz. Confusion, screaming, dying... and then the flames.
简单来说…就像斯卡里茨。疑惑、尖叫、死亡…然后是大火。
To a weasel who shoots from the bushes instead of a fair fight!
你就是个躲在灌木丛里射击、不敢公平对决的鼠辈！
What did you expect? That she was saving her cherry for some knobhead from Skalitz?
那你以为呢？她在为某个斯卡里茨的呆瓜守身如玉？
Like I said - If we can manage it without torturing, all the better. But on the other hand, those fuckers had no mercy either.
我说过了，如果我们不用拷打就能问出来，当然更好。但话说回来，那些混蛋也没对我们手软。
If you don't stop that, you'll end up in the pillory.
如果你不收手，你会上颈手枷的。
So, the pillory appeals to you, does it?
看来你忍不住想上颈手枷，是吗？
You're the one who should know where they got them, since you're a gunsmith.
这得问你呀，你可是个枪匠。
Hand cannon, can you believe it? Where did they get them?
手铳，你敢信？他们从哪儿弄来的？
Nah. Them nomads have a real respect for animals and wouldn't waste any part of a catch.
不是。他们游牧民非常尊重动物，不会浪费猎物的任何部位。
And now I'll drink to it, I reckon.
I'm looking for a hide from a rare white roebuck. And I think you know something about it...
我在找一张稀有的白狍子皮。我想你们应该知道一些情况…
And where might I find this Krizhan?
我要去哪里找这个克日然？
And you know what? Try asking around at that nomad camp up there in the rocks.
我跟你说，你可以去岩石间的游牧民营地打听一下。
Stop by Semine. I hear the saddler's hand Janek there is looking for a blacksmith.
牧羊人西格弗里德来过一趟。
牧羊人西格弗里德来过一趟。
牧羊人西格弗里德来过一趟。
牧羊人西格弗里德来过一趟。
Krizhan was looking for some labourers here recently.
最近克日然正在此处寻找帮手。
You could stop by Semine. Janek, the saddler's hand there, is looking for a blacksmith.
你可以去塞米那边看看。鞍匠的工人雅内克正在找铁匠呢。
No, and I don't really care. These nomads are none of my business.
不知道，我也不在乎。这些游牧民跟我无关。
Try asking around at that nomad camp up there in the rocks.
你可以去岩石间的游牧民营地打听一下。
Well, they made good use of the opportunity to line their purses.
嗯，他们就会趁机捞一笔钱。
I must have carried more than they could fill in Skalitz in a day.
我一天搬运的袋子可能比全斯卡里茨人一天见过的袋子还要多。
还有一些肉和祸根毒药。
Listen, laddie! There are rules to this duel, and you can only have a weapon befitting Tuchmacher's rank, meaning a flail or a hunting sword! And take off that plate, or there won't be any duel.
听着，小子！决斗是有规则的，你只能用符合图赫马赫身份的武器，比如钝器或者猎刀！你也不能穿板甲，否则别想决斗。
Das war schnell, he he. （真快啊，哈哈。）
Oh, Gott, hab Dank für diesen Tag.
Oh, Gott, hab Dank für diesen Tag. （谢天谢地熬到了今天。）
Oh, sakra… this doesn't look good.
Es ist vorbei, aber das ist nicht gut … Ich blute.
Es ist vorbei, aber das ist nicht gut … Ich blute. （完事了，但情况不妙……我还在流血。）
Gott, es wäre fast schiefgegangen. （天啊，差点完蛋了）
Yeah, you got what was coming, whoreson!
是的，这是你应得的报应，杂种！
Mein Gott, das war ein Kampf.
Mein Gott, das war ein Kampf. （天，真是场硬仗。）
Oh, Gott sei Dank. （哦，谢天谢地。）
Oh, mein Gott … es ist vorbei.
Oh, mein Gott … es ist vorbei. （天啊，终于结束了）
Oh, Scheiße, ich blute … das ist nicht gut.
Oh, Scheiße, ich blute … das ist nicht gut. （哦不，我在流血…靠，这可不太妙。）
Pah! He was finished before he started!
呸！他还没动手就已经完蛋了！
Ha! I knew I'd get him!
哈！我就知道我会干掉他！
That was quick! Hardly even hurt, eh?
真快！几乎没怎么伤到，对吗？
Und er ist erledigt. （干掉他了。）
Was hat er sich dabei gedacht, der Narr?
Was hat er sich dabei gedacht, der Narr? （这个蠢货在想些什么？）
Today's longsword champion, Henry of Skalitz!
今天的长剑冠军，斯卡里茨的亨利！
Henry of Skalitz! Welcome him once more!
斯卡里茨的亨利！再次欢迎他！
Henry of Skalitz! A skilled fighter and a good friend of Kuttenberg and all its people!
斯卡里茨的亨利！技艺精湛的斗士、库滕堡及其人民的好朋友！
Henry of Skalitz, who has already triumphed once today!
斯卡里茨的亨利，他今天已经获胜一次！
It seems Henry of Skalitz won't be gracing us with his presence today!
看来斯卡里茨的亨利今天不会赏脸光临了！
Henry of Skalitz! Lady Luck wasn't on his side during the longsword discipline, but let's see how he fares now!
斯卡里茨的亨利！他在长剑比赛中运气欠佳，看看他现在的表现如何！
Henry of Skalitz! A great fighter and adventurer!
斯卡里茨的亨利！伟大的斗士和冒险家！
比武冠军是斯卡里茨的亨利！
The famed and unrivalled Henry of Skalitz!
大名鼎鼎、战无敌手的斯卡里茨的亨利！
比武冠军是斯卡里茨的亨利！
Winner of the sword and shield discipline, Henry of Skalitz!
剑盾项目获胜者，斯卡里茨的亨利！
We go way back to Skalitz. She also survived the raid of Sigismund's army.
我们回到了斯卡里茨 。她也在西格斯蒙德的军队发动的突袭中活了下来。
When someone catches you, you'll rot in the pillory.
如果有人抓住你，你就在颈手枷上烂掉吧。
Lord Ruthard's daughter and the bastard son of the Lord of Skalitz who was driven out of his estate by Sigismund himself? That's not going to happen.
鲁瑟德领主的女儿和斯卡里茨领主的私生子？这个斯卡里茨领主还被西格斯蒙德亲自赶出了领地。这种事是行不通的。
And what about this Father Prokop?
And could it've been Father Prokop following her?
有没有可能是普罗科普神父在跟踪她？
I reckon you do, Ambrose. According to one of the documents, you were appointed seneschal of the Knights of the Cross with the Red Star.
我估计你知道，安布洛斯。根据其中一份文书，你被任命为红星十字骑士团的执事。
I found some documents, money and a cloak of the Knights of the Cross. That was yours, I assume.
我发现了一些文书、钱和一件红星十字骑士团斗篷。我猜它属于你。
I found some documents there from the Knights of the Cross. But Ambrose clearly wasn't interested in them. So what did he send you to get?
我在那里发现了一些红星十字骑士团的文书。但安布洛斯显然对它们不感兴趣。那么他派你去拿什么？
Couldn't it have been Father Prokop?
有没有可能是普罗科普神父干的？
A few nights ago, a herdsboy saw a black horseman ride into Apollonia. He thought it was an apparition.
几天前的晚上，一个牧羊人看到一个黑骑士骑马进入阿波罗尼亚。他以为那是一个幽灵。
It was a long time ago, but I heard she used to hang around you a lot. And Father Prokop didn't like it.
尽管那是很久之前的事了，但我听说她常跟你呆在一起，普罗科普神父为此很不乐意。
Do you know something about a nomad who's held captive somewhere around here?
你知不知道这附近有个游牧民被抓起来了？
我是亨利，斯卡里茨的亨利。
An old dog wanted some young meat but ended up with a nibble, eh?
癞蛤蟆想吃天鹅肉，结果扑了一场空，对吧？
So for you, justice and revenge are one and the same?
那对你来说，正义和复仇是同一回事吗？
I am looking for a nomad boy, he's supposed to be held captive around here.
我在找一个游牧民小伙，他应该被囚禁在这附近。
There was a brand new cloak of the Knights of the Cross in the hiding-place. It's clear that the man doing the digging hid it there.
藏匿地点有一件全新的红星十字骑士团的斗篷。显然，是那个挖掘的人把它藏在了那里。
That's right. They call me Frantishek.
是的，人们都叫我弗朗特齐歇克。
Yes, I am Brother Arnold, a Knight of the Cross with the Red Star, and these are Brothers Sibald and Niclas.
是的，我是阿诺德修士，是光荣的红星十字骑士团的骑士，这是西伯尔德和尼克拉斯修士。
Try to get close unseen and set fire to the haystack on the right-hand side of the yard. Then his crossbow will be useless.
想办法悄无声息地走到院子右侧，放火烧掉那里的干草堆。这样他的弩就废了。
He was just about to flee from here as well. We took him by surprise, but he had time to grab that damned crossbow… and shoot Clesgine.
他正准备从这里逃出去。我们打了他一个措手不及，但他拿起了那把该死的弩…射中了克莱西涅。
Otherwise we won't have a chance against his crossbow in that gorge.
否则，在峡谷里，我们没办法招架他的弩。
I am Konrad, Knight of the Cross with the Red Star.
我是康拉德，红星十字骑士团的骑士。
Father Prokop? I don't know him.
普罗科普神父？我不认识他。
Sakra! I almost shot you at that mill this morning, fellah!
妈的！今早在磨坊那我差点就朝你射击了，伙计！
No… no… there is no absolution. Not yet…
不…不…我还无法获得宽恕。还不行…
I don't want to go back there. Nothing good ever happened to me in that house.
我不想回去。那屋子从来没发生过什么好事。
Aren't so bad? I buried my first husband, and now the Lord has taken another man from me.
没有那么糟糕？我安葬了第一任丈夫，现在老天又将我的另一个男人夺走了。
They call me Hare. I've been waiting here for you.
他们叫我黑尔。我一直在这里等你。
Oof, they got what they wanted... We did it, eh?
呼，他们这是自讨苦吃……我们做到了，对吗？
Come now! I'll be glad to see what kind of warrior our boy from Skalitz has become!
来吧！我很乐意看看来自斯卡里茨的小伙子成了什么样的勇士！
Come now! I'll be glad to see what kind of warrior our boy from Skalitz has become!
来吧！我很乐意看看来自斯卡里茨的小伙子成了什么样的勇士！
Come now! I'll be glad to see what kind of warrior our boy from Skalitz has become!
来吧！我很乐意看看来自斯卡里茨的小伙子成了什么样的勇士！
Come now! I'll be glad to see what kind of warrior our boy from Skalitz has become!
来吧！我很乐意看看来自斯卡里茨的小伙子成了什么样的勇士！
Shoot those ones carrying the ladders!
Ausgezeichnet! Du hast ein gutes Geschäft gemacht, mein Freund! Bis bald!
Ausgezeichnet! Du hast ein gutes Geschäft gemacht, mein Freund! Bis bald!（太好了！这是笔好买卖，朋友！回见！）
Ausgezeichnet! Du hast ein gutes Geschäft gemacht, mein Herr! Lebe wohl!

Ausgezeichnet! Du wirst sicher zufrieden sein, mein Freund! Lebe wohl!

Danke. Das war ein gutes Geschäft, mein Herr!
Danke. Das war ein gutes Geschäft, mein Herr!（谢谢你先生，真是笔愉快的交易！）
Danke und viel Glück für die Zukunft, mein Herr.
Danke und viel Glück für die Zukunft, mein Herr.（多谢先生，祝你好运！）

Vielen Dank! Es war mir eine Freude, mit dir Geschäfte zu machen, mein Herr!（十分感谢，先生！和你做生意真是荣幸！）
Vielen Dank, mein Freund! Es war mir eine Freude. Bis bald!
Vielen Dank, mein Freund! Es war mir eine Freude. Bis bald!（十分感谢，我的朋友！这是我的荣幸，再会！）
Vielen Dank! Es war mir eine Freude, mit dir Geschäfte zu machen, mein Freund!
Vielen Dank! Es war mir eine Freude, mit dir Geschäfte zu machen, mein Freund!（非常感谢！很荣幸和你做生意，我的朋友！）
I'm looking for Tibor, a nomad who's being held against his will somewhere around here.
我在找提波，一个在附近被抓的游牧民。
We dealt with them nomads, and we'll deal with you! At him, lads!
我们能解决得了那帮游牧民，我就不信我们解决不了你！兄弟们上！
Aye. They plotted with some robber baron called Gules and brought the cart to him.
是的。他们和一个叫“古勒斯”的贵族强盗密谋，把马车带去给他。
I'm Henry of Skalitz, squire to Lord Capon of Pirkstein.
我是斯卡里茨的亨利，皮克斯坦因的卡蓬大人的侍从。
I'm Henry of Skalitz, squire to Lord Capon of Pirkstein.
我是斯卡里茨的亨利，皮克斯坦因的卡蓬大人的侍从。
He wanted to prove the Knights of Maleshov didn’t wear spurs just for show.
他想证明马列索夫的骑士们穿马刺不只是作秀。
I heard him say he was going to blame his hired hand. He said you'd put him in the pillory and he'd get compensation.
听他说，他打算归咎于自己的雇工。他说你要将雇工关进颈手枷，他要得到赔偿。
We Knights seek salvation in helping the poor and suffering. We are not murderers!
我们骑士团帮助穷苦之人，以此寻求救赎。我们不是杀人犯！
I understand. I've been through the same, when Skalitz was burned to the ground. People I'd known all my life died there.
我明白的。斯卡里茨被烧成灰烬的时候，我也经历了同样的事。我此前所有认识的人都死在了那里。
That was a good hit, ben zoyne, eh?
打得不错，ben zoyne（贱货），对吗？
I don't know. I thought I'd spend the bloody silver, but instead of that we're as poor as church mice again.
我不知道。我以为终于有机会花那些该死的银子，结果我们又穷得像是教堂里的老鼠一样。
Fuck you, Jan! I'd trade places with you in a heartbeat, trust me.
去你妈的，扬！相信我，我愿意马上和你交换位置。
Would you mind if I kept the mace?
你介意我留下这把钉头锤吗？
I found Janosh in a pillory in Miskowitz. But I managed to get him out of it.
亚诺什被关在米斯科维茨的颈手枷上了，不过我把他弄了出来。
这是“溃疡”的那把钉头锤。
He shouldn't have gotten caught so stupidly, then! Did he tell you how he ended up in the pillory in the first place?
他就不该这么蠢被抓住！他有没有跟你说是怎么进的颈手枷？
Oh… and I almost forgot. When you're done, bring me Canker's mace. As proof.
哦…我差点忘了。你完成任务后，要将“溃疡”的钉头锤带回来，作为证物。
Seriously? So you brought me his mace like I told you to?
真的吗？你将我要的钉头锤带回来了吗？
Well, I got the lullaby potion, just like you asked. But… I was seen pouring it into the bull's water.
我拿到了你要的安眠毒药。但是…有人看到我把它倒进了公牛喝的水里。
That won't be a problem. I know this brew called Lullaby potion. I'll pour some in his water trough, that should do the trick!
那不是问题。我知道有一种叫作安眠毒药的东西，我会倒一些在牛的饮水槽里，这样应该就能奏效了！
But the bailiff couldn't care less! He said we should deal with Olbram ourselves, or he'll have us caned and clapped in the pillory.
但执行官一点都不在乎！他说我们应该自己对付奥尔布拉姆，不然就让我们吃鞭子再把我们关入颈手枷。
What do you think of those nomads in the camp by the pond?
你对在池塘边扎营的那些游牧民有什么看法？
What do you think of those nomads in the camp by the pond?
你对在池塘边扎营的那些游牧民有什么看法？
What do you think of those nomads in the camp by the pond?
你对在池塘边扎营的那些游牧民有什么看法？
What about the nomads by the pond? How are you getting along with them?
说说在池塘边扎营的那些游牧民吧。你跟他们相处得如何？
About the nomad camp by the pond.
关于池塘边的那个游牧民营地。
About the nomad camp by the pond…
关于池塘边的那个游牧民营地…
About the nomad camp by the pond.
关于池塘边的那个游牧民营地。
About the Roma camp by the pond…
关于池塘边的那个游牧民营地…
So, we're here. Gnarly, tell the youngster here what's what.
我们到了。格纳利，你要和这个年轻人说什么就说吧。
Tuma? Oh come on, he's drinking too. We had some schnapps together a moment ago.
图马？哦，得了吧，他自己也喝着呢。刚才我们还一起喝了点烈酒。
Captain? What'll happen with that robber baron from Apollonia now that we've captured him?
队长？我们已经抓住了阿波罗尼亚的贵族强盗，接下来该怎么处置他？
És most húzz el innen, vagy kaphatsz még! Tűnés!
És most húzz el innen，vagy kaphatsz még！Tunés！
Katherine? Ő az enyém, érted? Csak az enyém!
Katherine？O az enyém， érted？Csak az enyém！
Halt! What are you after here?
This is indeed the seal of the Lords of Leipa...
确实是莱佩家族的印章……
While my master is a member of the League of Lords, who side with King Sigismund.
而我的主公是领主联盟的成员，支持西格斯蒙德国王。
Should we get ready for a fight?
Besides, we wouldn't stand a chance against them.
再说了，我们本来也打不过。
吾乃皮克斯坦因的汉斯·卡蓬爵士。
Take it easy, Henry. They're wearing von Bergow's colours, they're from Trosky.
没事，亨利。看穿着，应该是冯·波尔高的部下，从特罗斯基来的。
Can you not distinguish between a noble and a bandit, Sir?
阁下，您分不清贵族和强盗吗？
My real father is a nobleman. He oversaw the royal mines in Skalitz.
我的生父是名贵族，他负责监管斯卡里茨的皇家矿场。
I'm from Skalitz, so I know a little bit about mining.
我来自斯卡里茨，所以我对采矿略知一二。
What happened in Skalitz was a great tragedy for the entire kingdom. It was one of the highest yielding mines.
斯卡里茨发生的事对整个王国来说都是一场惨烈的悲剧，那是产量最高的一大矿场。
Yes. The lad should already be in the pillory.
是的。那小伙应该已经被关进颈手枷了。
So what are you waiting for? I want him in the pillory!
那你还在等什么呢？我想让他被关进颈手枷！
Because my whole family died in Skalitz. I don't want that to happen to you as well.
因为我全家都死在了斯卡里茨。我不希望你们的村子也重蹈覆辙。
What did Janosh do to end up in the pillory?
亚诺什犯了什么事，怎么会被关在颈手枷里？
A fellah just like that is in the pillory right now. What do you want from him?
有个像你说的人现在被关在颈手枷里。你找他做什么？
They rob and steal. Nothing's sacred to them, and they've even killed a couple of people - most recently a local herdsboy!
他们抢劫、偷盗。无恶不作，甚至还杀过几个人——最近的一次是当地的牧羊人！
You fight like an old hag!
Cedo nulli! Aut vincere aut mori!
Cedo nulli! Aut vincere aut mori! （永不退缩，至死方休！）
I might be old, but I'm not written off!
我年纪虽大，但也不是吃素的！
Smile, you fuck! While you've still got teeth!
趁你还有牙，赶紧笑吧，废物！
There's nothing to be done now. Go and get some rest, Kozliek. We'll come up with what to do next later.
现在想这些也无济于事了。去休息一下吧，科兹里克。我们稍后再想下一步该怎么办。
You mean Janosh Uher? I saved him from the pillory a while ago.
你说亚诺什·乌尔？我前不久把他从颈手枷上救出来了。
Lord von Bergow isn't here yet, but Chamberlain Ulrich assures me he'll arrive any moment now.
冯·波尔高大人还没到，但管家乌尔里希向我保证他很快就会到了。
And the way to get it leads right through the Chamberlain and his quarters.
而那本书就在管家的住处可以拿到。
But Dorothy said none of the girls want anything to do with the chamberlain because of his "special tastes".
但是多萝西说，由于管家的“特殊品味”，没有一个女孩愿意和他扯上关系。
But the girls said they didn't want anything to do with him because of his "special tastes".
但是女孩们说，由于管家的“特殊品味”，她们不愿意和他扯上关系。
红色的，蒂罗尔锦缎做的。
Not so fast. It won't be that easy with the chamberlain.
没那么简单。有管家在，这件事没那么容易。
The Chamberlain of Trosky, Sir Ulrich von Schaumberg!
特罗斯基的管家，乌尔里希·冯·沙恩伯格爵士！
It seems it's not about what Chamberlain Schaumberg did to them, but he wanted them to do to him.
这不是因为沙恩伯格管家对她们做了什么，而是他希望她们对她做什么。
And just in case… there's this potion I carry around. A couple of drops and the chamberlain will sleep like a log.
以防万一……我随身带着这种药水。只须滴上几滴，就能让管家睡得像根木头。
Hmm… The chamberlain? As in the castle caretaker? I'm not interested in some little clerk.
嗯……管家？就是那个城堡的看守人？我对小人物没兴趣。
I must say, I'm quite curious about the Chamberlain now.
我必须说，我现在对管家很好奇。
Hurry up, then. We don't want to keep the chamberlain waiting.
那就快点吧。别让管家久等了。
Then I give you my word. I, Henry of Skalitz, son of a nobleman and squire to Lord Capon, promise you this.
那我答应你。我，斯卡里茨的亨利，贵族之子，卡蓬大人的侍从，在此发誓。
Gut, dann mal los!（好，来砍价吧！）
Gut, dann mal los!（好，开始吧！）
Du verkaufst mir ganz schön zwielichtiges Zeug.
Du verkaufst mir ganz schön zwielichtiges Zeug.（这些东西来路不明。）
Heh, du verkaufst mir ganz schön zwielichtiges Zeug.
Heh, du verkaufst mir ganz schön zwielichtiges Zeug.（你想在我这儿销赃。）
Hmm, das stinkt zum Himmel.（这可是赃物，朋友。）
Hmm, das stinkt zum Himmel.（嗯，这里面肯定有鬼。）
Was soll’s, warum nicht?（无所谓，试试看吧？）
Hm, was soll’s, warum nicht?（好，未尝不可……）
Ja, das ist gut.（这就行了。）
Ja, das ist gut.（这就行了。）
Aye, that sum will convince me.
好，我可以接受这个价格。
Nein, das bringt doch nichts.（不成，没法谈了。）
Nein, das bringt doch nichts.（不成，没法谈了。）
Nein, so bestimmt nicht.（不行，这我没法接受，伙计。）
Nein, so bestimmt nicht.（不行，这我没法接受，伙计。）
Hm, das könnte vielleicht gehen.（嗯，或许可以……）
Wofür hältst du mich?（你把我当成什么人了？）
Was machst du da, du Schurke?
Was machst du da, du Schurke?（干什么呢，你这小偷？）
Was soll das, Mann?（你在干什么，伙计？）
Was machst du da, du Schurke?
Was machst du da, du Schurke?（干什么呢，你这小偷？）
Was soll das, Mann?（这是干什么，伙计？）
Wofür hältst du mich?（你把我当成什么人了？）
They call me Henry. Henry of Skalitz.
我叫亨利，斯卡里茨的亨利！
Areet, Henry of Skalitz. Would you be a canny lad and fetch us drouth lads some liquor?
好吧，斯卡里茨的亨利。能不能请你行个善举，给我们这些口渴的兄弟拿些酒水来？
And what's this Skalitz of yours like?
那么，斯卡里茨是个怎样的地方呢？
No. Skalitz was torched to the ground and we had to flee.
没了。斯卡里茨被烧成了焦土，我们只得背井离乡。
They call it Silver Skalitz, because they used to mine the stuff there.
人们将它称为银之斯卡里茨，因为那里曾是开采银矿的地方。
I told you about them though! The fellahs in the tavern in Zhelejov were saying there's some foreigners like that camping in the rocks down by the pond!
我跟你说我知道他们的事！在哲勒约夫酒馆里的人说，有一群这样的外地人在池塘边的山谷间扎营！
We were fighting outside, but that fucker got hold of his falchion and let me have it in the guts.
我们在外面打着，但那个狗操的拿着他的砍刀捅了我肚子。
Not only did we try, Sir! I found valerian in Grozav's tent. It's used to make Dollmaker potion.
大人，我们何止是尝试了！我在格罗扎夫的帐篷里发现了缬草。它是用于制作玩偶毒药的材料。
You brewed it up yourself! I found lots of valerian in your tent, which is used to make Dollmaker potion!
你自己熬制了毒药！我在你的帐篷里发现了大量缬草，它就是用来制作玩偶毒药的材料！
Now? Hajso na! Come later gadjo, when I won't have so much work.
现在？Hajso na（不行）！等我不忙的时候再来找我吧，gadjo（外来人）。
I'd like to learn how to handle an axe or mace.
我想学怎么用斧头或者钉头锤。
Tell me a bit about you nomads. You seem so different to us.
跟我说说关于你们游牧民的事情吧。你们看起来似乎与我们很不相同。
An axe, mace, hammer, it doesn't matter.
斧头、钉头锤、锤子，无所谓。
Not just ale. I like wine too, and I wouldn't turn my nose up and some nice schnapps either.
不只是啤酒，葡萄酒我也喜欢。只要味道好，烈酒我也来者不拒。
As it happens, I found a nice book there. Of course, I can't read, but there was some pretty fun pictures in it.
我倒是碰巧在那里找到一本好书。当然，我不识字，但里面有一些很有趣的图画。
Ein anderer ist tot! （又干掉一个！）
Du bist so gut wie tot.
Du bist so gut wie tot. (你死定了！）
Du hast es vermasselt! (你完蛋了！）
Gut gemacht! Tötet ihn! (打得好！宰了他！）
Ha! He doesn't know which way is up!
哈！他已经找不到出路了！
Ha! He doesn't know which way to turn!
哈！他已经找不到出路了！
Once more and we can go home!
再给他一击，我们就可以回家了！
Auf ihn mit Gebrüll! （没错，干他！）
All the saints should see this! And you'll soon be meeting them!
所有圣徒都应该看看这个！而你马上就会见到他们了！
Fuck! I can't take him on my own!
操！我一个人对付不了他！
Come to me, someone! I'm like a sieve!
快来救我，来人啊！我快被捅成筛子了！
Help me, he wounded me badly!
Help me with him! I'm bleeding!
帮我干他！我一直在流血！
Henry of Skalitz, a modern-day Alexander the Great!
斯卡里茨的亨利，当代的亚历山大大帝！
Well, that some fellah called Jan is in charge.
那个叫扬的家伙是他们的头领。
There's some fellah called Jan in charge, they occupied Nebakov and that bastard Istvan's joined them.
有个叫扬的家伙是他们的头领，他们还把内巴科夫给占领了，而且那个混蛋伊斯特万还加入了他们。
That there's some fellah called Jan in charge and that that bastard Istvan has joined them.
有个叫扬的家伙是他们的头领，而且那个混蛋伊斯特万加入了他们。
That they're based in Nebakov and some fellah called Jan is in charge.
他们的基地在内巴科夫，而且那个叫扬的家伙是他们的头领。
I've seen Janosh. What's he in the pillory for?
我见过了亚诺什。他为什么会被关在颈手枷里？
I'd be happy to help. The likes of him belong behind bars or in the pillory.
我很乐意效劳。像他那样的人就该关进大牢或者颈手枷里。
Bailiff! I found a dead herdsboy a short way from the village. Him and his whole flock were killed.
执行官！我在离村子不远的地方，发现了一个死去的牧羊人。他和他的羊群都被杀了。
That's the scoundrel I have locked up in the pillory outside my house right now.
那个恶棍现在就锁在我家外面的颈手枷里。
Here's the key to the pillory. It's better if you free him yourself. I don't want him spitting on my boots.
这是颈手枷钥匙。要是你能亲自放他出来就更好了，我可不想让他在我靴子上吐口水。
I can wait. So can Janosh. He'll stay in the pillory until you pay up.
我能等，亚诺什也是。在你付钱之前，他会一直待在颈手枷上。
Tönkre tesz, ha más férfiakra kacsintgatsz, tudod? De összeszedem a pénzt és elviszlek ebből az átkozott fürdőből.
Tonkre tesz，ha más férfiakra kacsintgatsz，tudod？De osszeszedem a pénzt és elviszlek ebbol az átkozott furdobol。
Miért nem mehetek oda hozzá egyszerűen, és fizethetek a fürdésért?
Miért nem mehetek oda hozzá egyszeruen，és fizethetek a fürdésért？
Alright… I might have added a little schnapps to it.
好吧……可能是因为我在里面加了一点烈酒。
I'm sorry, Henry… but I thought…
On the second floor, right across from the stairs. There's a green wreath on the wall there.
在三楼，楼梯对面，墙上有绿色的花环的那间。
On the second floor, right across from the stairs. There's a green wreath on the wall there.
在三楼，楼梯对面，墙上有绿色的花环的那间。
Yes. Jan and I were exactly the same. Our wedding was the talk of the county for quite some time.
是啊，当初我和扬也是这副模样。我们的婚礼曾经是全郡的佳话。
Yes, unfortunately. They set up camp right next to the nomads, by the Rocktower Pond.
晦气啊！他们就在石塔池塘边，挨着那些游牧民落脚的地方扎营了。
Jan… Have some sympathy, he's getting married today. It's no wonder he's nervous.
扬……理解一下吧，他今天要结婚了，难免会紧张。
You know I don't like that ugly word. What do you want to know about the "art"?
你知道我不喜欢那个难听的词。关于那门“艺术”，你想知道些什么？
You're as clumsy as a blind dog and about as inconspicuous as a cow at a banquet table. You've got a lot to learn!
你就像一只瞎狗一样笨拙，就像宴会桌上的牛一样显眼。你有很多东西要学！
Seems like everyone does nowadays… But if you're not looking to draw attention, a dagger in your belt will do just fine.
现在这世道谁都这样……但如果你不希望引起别人的注意，腰带上插把匕首就可以了。
I… mistook you for someone else. Do you know Kunesh from Skalitz?
我……把你认成别人了。你认识斯卡里茨的库尼什吗?
I'm here on behalf of Sir Jan of Suchotlesky. I'm to meet with László Farkas.
我是代表苏霍茨基的扬爵士来的。我要见拉斯洛·法卡斯。
You see, I don't hear very well. Back when I was fighting against those Hungarian raiders, I had a hand cannon go off next to me head. Ever since then, I've been half deaf.
是这样的，我听力不好。我跟那些匈牙利突袭者作战时，一发手铳在我耳边炸了。从那时起，我就成了半聋的人。
Hold your horses! You'd just clap everyone in the stocks right away, whip them on the pillory and maybe even worse.
慢着！你可以马上把所有人都关进颈手枷，抽打他们，也许还能做得更狠。
I lost my whole family, my girl… all dead.
我失去了全家人，我的女人… 都死了。
By the way, you lot all think running the castle is a piece of cake, but for sure Chamberlain Ulrich hasn't got it easy.
顺便说一句，你们都认为管理城堡很容易，但可以肯定的是，管家乌尔里希并不轻松。
If you try to break in somewhere, you'll be spending the night in the pillory.
如果你试图闯入，你就得在颈手枷上过夜了。
And thieves and cutthroats belong in the pillory.
颈手枷是小偷和亡命之徒的归宿。
You were causing trouble, and I'm fed up. You'll pay a fine, or I'll lock you up in the pillory.
你惹了麻烦，而我已经受够了。要不你交罚款，要不我把你送进颈手枷。
I don't know what your problem is, but you're not going to fight with me, you bastard!
我不知道你有什么毛病，但你不能跟我打架，你这个混蛋！
Pay up, or I'll take you to the pillory!
付钱，否则我会把你送进颈手枷！
This is your last chance. Otherwise, I'll punch you so hard, you'll wake up in the pillory!
最后给你一次机会。否则，我就狠狠地揍你一顿，让你在颈手枷上醒来！
Did you think you'd get away with that? Freeing someone from the pillory, as if you were a guard?
你以为你能逃过这一劫吗？把人从颈手枷中放走，就好像你是个警卫一样？
You can't just free a prisoner from the pillory!
你不能就这样把一个犯人从颈手枷里放出来！
I won't be intimidated by a coward like you! Pay up, or I'll drag you to the pillory myself!
我不会被你这样的懦夫吓倒！赔钱，否则我就把你送进颈手枷！
Alright then. I'll turn a blind eye, just this once.
好吧，我就睁一只眼闭一只眼，但下不为例。
In that case, the pillory awaits.
这样的话，就等着进颈手枷吧。
How about I lend you a few days in the pillory!
我借你个颈手枷待几天怎么样！
I won't put up with such things here. Either you'll pay for all your wrongdoings or I'll drag you away to the pillory!
我不会容忍这种恶行。你要么为自己的恶行付赎金，要么我就把你送进颈手枷！
You're the bastard who's been freeing people from the pillory!
你就是那个把人从颈手枷里放出来的混蛋！
You'll pay up and show me whether you stole anything. Otherwise, we'll deal with your unruliness in the pillory.
你要付钱，并让我看看你是否偷了东西。你再无法无天的话，我们会把你关进颈手枷。
Pay a fine, or I'll lock you up in the pillory. You'll get over your foolish ideas there!
缴纳罚款，否则我就把你关进颈手枷。你在那里才不会犯蠢！
Pay up, or I'll drag you to the pillory myself! Let's see your political import then!
给钱，否则我就亲自把你送进颈手枷！到时我们再看看你的政治背景吧！
I'll lock you up in the pillory until you rot!
我会把你关进颈手枷，关到你腐烂！
Don't worry, we'll lock him in the pillory… and that horse of his too!
别担心，我们会把他拷上颈手枷…还有他的那匹马！
Repül a nyílvessző, repül és repül és elrepül valahova a faszba!
Repul a nyílvesszo, repul és repul és elrepul valahova a faszba!
És újra a közepibe! Még csak meg se erőltetem magam!
És újra a kozepibe! Még csak meg se eroltetem magam!
You get your arrows or bolts, stand on your mark and shoot at your target, aiming to get the most points.
你拿上自己的箭矢或弩箭，站在你的标记位置上，向你的靶子射箭，努力获得最高分数。
I'll set everything up, I'll even get you some bolts, but in the meantime you'll need to find yourself a crossbow.
我会安排好一切，还会给你一些弩箭，但你需要自己找一张弩。
I'll set everything up, I'll even get you some bolts, but in the meantime you'll need to find yourself a crossbow.
我会安排好一切，甚至会给你一些弩箭，但你需要自己找一张弩。
I give arrows or bolts to the archers, and they try to hit their target to get the most points.
我给弓箭手发箭矢或弩箭，每个人都得努力击中靶子，尽可能多得分。
Mi a szarért célozgatok, lőhetnék akár vakon is...
Mi a szarért célozgatok, lohetnék akár vakon is...
Godwin! Get over here with that crossbow and join the line!
古德温！带上你的弩，入列！
But take care of the old fellah! He might be just a piece of wood, but he saved my arse more than once.
但是照顾好这个老伙计！它虽然只是一根木头，但不止一次救过我。
They made a deal with some robber baron by the name of Gules to take the cart to him with the goods.
他们和一个名叫古勒斯的贵族强盗做了一笔交易，要把马车和货物一起送去给他。
I can do without girls with voices like that. Now get going!
那种嗓音的姑娘我可不要。现在快走吧！
I choose Tibor as my champion, he will trample you into ground! You will compete in horse riding and fist fighting, the nomad way!
我要派提波上阵，他会让你输到无地自容！你们就来比比骑马和拳击吧，以游牧民的方式来比！
I'll show you! Once I report you, you'll get the pillory!
我会让你好看的！一旦我举报你，你就会要戴上颈手枷！
I'll give you what you deserve! I'll have you clapped in the pillory!
我会让你得到应有的报应！我要让你戴上颈手枷！
Let's go. The bailiff will explain it to you, and you'll have plenty of time to think about what you did in the pillory!
我们走吧。执行官会向你解释的，你戴上颈手枷后有足够的时间反思你的所作所为！
Nem elég! Megöllek, és mindent ellopok a döglött testedről!
Nem elég! Megollek, és mindent ellopok a doglott testedrol!
Now either you pay up, or it's the pillory for you, arsehole!
现在你要么付钱，要么就等着戴上颈手枷吧，混蛋！
Hmph, you'll get the pillory for this. Come on then!
哼，你会因此戴上颈手枷的。来吧！
Cough up some coin, or I'll turn you in and you'll pay for it in the pillory!
掏钱，不然我就告发你，让你戴着颈手枷掏钱！
Pay up, or it's the pillory for you!
把钱付清，不然就等着戴上颈手枷吧！
Pay up for all the damages, or you'll end up in the pillory!
赔偿所有损失，不然你就要戴上颈手枷！
You'll get the pillory for this!
你会因此戴上颈手枷的！
They'll clap you in the pillory for this!
他们会为此给你戴上颈手枷！
They'll clap you in the pillory for this!
他们会为此给你戴上颈手枷！
You'll pay for that! I'll call the catchpoles and they'll clap you in the pillory!
你会为此付出代价！我要叫治安官给你戴上颈手枷！
I'm from Jan Zizka's retinue, we want to put King Wenceslas back on the throne.
我是扬·杰式卡的随从，我们想让瓦茨拉夫国王重新登上王位。
I'm from Skalitz… From here, you'd have to go towards Kolin and Kuttenberg, then turn towards the Sasau River.
我来自斯卡里茨…你可以从这里前往科林和库滕堡，然后再前往莎邵河。
Only Sigismund's army burnt Skalitz to the ground… But when I saw your maypole, it reminded me of him.
只是西格斯蒙德的军队将斯卡里茨烧成了灰烬…但是我看见你们的五朔节花柱时，就想起了西格斯蒙德。
Yes. My name is Henry of Skalitz and I've come to take your burden upon myself. Exactly as it's written in the contract.
是的。我是斯卡里茨的亨利，我是来接替你的任务的。和契约上写的一模一样。
Yes, I have. My name is Henry of Skalitz and I've come to take your burden upon myself. Exactly as it's written in the contract.
是的，我是。我是斯卡里茨的亨利，我是来接替你的任务的。和契约上写的一模一样。
My name's Henry! Henry of Skalitz!
我的名字是亨利！斯卡里茨的亨利！
You first, Henry of Skalitz. Up the ladder! Until the oath is made, I can't leave you down here alone with the pit of hell.
你先走，斯卡里茨的亨利。上梯子！在宣誓之前，我不能让你在下面独自面对地狱之坑。
No bloody way! And how did you enjoy the pillory? Did they give you a proper whipping?
怎么可能！被关在颈手枷上是什么感觉？他们对你用了鞭刑吗？
Is it far? Zizka won't make it too far on foot.
很远吗？杰式卡现在这样子，走不了远路啊。
Look here, big man. I kicked the arses of Stanley and all the others here.
听着，大块头。我把斯塔尼克和在场的其他人揍得屁滚尿流。
But I have a proposition for you. The local lads like to practise their fighting moves while I watch over them.
不过我有个提议。当地的小伙们喜欢在我旁观的时候练习他们的招式。
Fuck me! You know everything, don't you?
He's kind of like the local buffoon. His name's Tobias, but everyone just calls him Darling.
他有点像本地的小丑。他名叫托比亚斯，但人人都唤他达令。
Stanley is the strongest. He works on the farm and has quite a big mouth on him, but he has the strength of two men.
斯塔尼克是最厉害的。他在农场干活，总是口无遮拦，但一身力气抵得上两个人。
Don't count your chickens before they hatch. Darling may be a bumbler, but Stanley and Tuma are no pushovers.
别高兴太早。达令可能是个蠢货，但斯塔尼克和图马可不是好惹的。
So, Tobias, do you enjoy fighting?
那么，托比亚斯，你喜欢打架吗？
I'm looking for a woman. She was talking to Chamberlain Ulrich, but she vanished. Have you seen her?
我正在找一个女人。她原本在和管家乌尔里希谈话，但后来消失了。你见过她吗？
I, Henry of Skalitz, fully aware of all the risks, am prepared to represent Tuchmacher in combat to restore his honour!
我，来自斯卡里茨的亨利，充分意识到了所有风险，准备代表图赫马赫进行战斗，以恢复他的名誉！
我是来自斯卡里茨的亨利。
我从银之斯卡里茨逃出来的。
Why wouldn't I? I'd love to have a beer with you. After all, in Skalitz I grew up among miners.
何乐不为呢？我想和你一起喝杯啤酒。毕竟，我在斯卡里茨时就是在矿工堆中长大的。
I agree with Father Marian. I grew up next to mines and we never came across any pit to hell.
我同意神父马里安的话。我在矿场旁边长大，我们从未见过通往地狱的坑洞。
You'll go with Kubyenka to get the hand cannons he maybe surely hid somewhere.
你和库宾卡一起去他藏手铳的地方拿手炮。
You can only use a weapon befitting Tuchmacher's rank, which means a flail or a hunting sword!
你只能使用符合图赫马赫身份的武器，也就是连枷或者猎刀！
Listen here, youngster! You'll fight with what's appropriate for a man of Tuchmacher's status - some bludgeon or hunting sword! And take off that plate or there'll be no duel!
听着，小子！你得使用符合图赫马赫身份的武器，也就是棍棒或者猎刀！还有，把板甲脱了，否则别想决斗！
Silver Skalitz? You people mine silver there?
银之斯卡里茨？那里的人是都在开采银矿吗？
Well… how about some hand cannons?
It's only happenstance. This isn't the first nor the last time that wolves dare to venture into town.
这只是偶然事件。这不是狼第一次，也不是最后一次闯进城内。
Then it's the pillory for you!
那你就得戴上颈手枷了！
Just as I thought. Matthias's hunting sword is much better than that shiv of yours.
不出我所料。马蒂亚斯的猎刀比你的那把小刀好得多。
You can sleep upstairs in the barn. There's plenty of room on the hay.
到畜棚楼上去睡吧，干草上有不少空间。
I've heard that wind is blowing from them dodgy nomads.
我听传言说那些狡诈的游牧民在偷马。
I'm seeking reinforcements for Jan of Suchotlesky.
我在为苏霍茨基的扬寻求援军。
他是怎么卖弄本事的呢？
I'm seeking reinforcements for Jan of Suchotlesky.
我在为苏霍茨基的扬寻求援军。
To King Wenceslas and his tournaments.
To King Wenceslas and his tournaments.
First past the Town's end and Tuft.
First past the Town's end and Tuft.
First of a Hundred and Tooth.
First of a Hundred and Tooth.
I’ve heard you organise riding competitions here.
I’ve heard you organise riding competitions here.
You’ve got a problem with Cumans?
You’ve got a problem with Cumans?
I’ll have a word with Mikolai first.
I’ll have a word with Mikolai first.
What now that the mounted archery is finished?
What now that the mounted archery is finished?
I'd like to shoot a bit.
I'd like to shoot a bit.
I'm seeking reinforcements for Jan of Suchotlesky.
我在为苏霍茨基的扬寻求援军。
Do you know about any work for a blacksmith?
你知道有什么铁匠可以做的活儿吗？
这里是你负责给马钉蹄铁吗？
I've heard strange things about you.
我听说过一些关于你的传言。
Tell me about the magical horseshoes.
跟我说说有魔力的马蹄铁吧。
I heard you have the best horses in the region.
我听说你这里有这一片最好的马。
波希米亚反手式（徒手战技）
How did the race turn out?
How did the race turn out?
Did you hear about the attack on Skalitz?
你听说斯卡里茨遇袭的事了吗？
Can't you think of any other solution?
And what about an cleaver or hunting sword?
那么切肉刀或是猎刀呢？
How do you and the nomads get along?
你们和游牧民的关系如何？
I want to talk about Skalitz.
我想谈谈关于斯卡里茨的事情。
黑尔从我这把它偷走了！
I'll wait and then we'll go.
我想等时间到了，然后我们一起出发。
I'll live a life of adventure.
我向往充满冒险的生活。
I'll live a life of adventure.
我向往充满冒险的生活。
I can do a better job.
我可以更好的胜任工作。
未使用完美格挡潜行偷袭成功
使用完美格挡潜行偷袭成功
Where can I find the herdsboy?
I got the white roebuck's hide.
I got the white roebuck's hide.
I have that white roebuck's hide for you.
我给你带来了白狍子皮。
可能是一只白色狍子的？
游牧民的荣耀 坏结局
游牧民的荣耀 好结局
I'm looking for medicine for the chamberlain.
我回来了，可以继续了吗？
What can I do with the items I've forged?
我锻造出来的物品能做什么用？
I'm seeking reinforcements for Jan of Suchotlesky.
我在为苏霍茨基的扬寻求援军。
I'm seeking reinforcements for Jan of Suchotlesky.
我在为苏霍茨基的扬寻求援军。
Jan has the right to know.
苏霍茨基的扬派我来的。
That makes sense. Jan will understand.
How long have you known Jan Zizka?
你认识扬·杰式卡多久了？
How is a hand cannon made?
I’ve heard you organise horse-riding competitions here.
I’ve heard you organise horse-riding competitions here.
What now that the racing is finished?
What now that the racing is finished?
The mounted archery challenge is done.
The mounted archery challenge is done.
Let us go and look at the altar.
Let us go and look at the altar.
I talked to Dorothy about the chamberlain.
我跟多萝西说了管家的事。
I talked to the bathhouse wenches about the chamberlain.
我和澡堂女仆谈了谈管家的事。
约翰应该有个像样的坟墓。
The conciliatory cross is to commemorate Jan?
带有和解之意的十字架是为了纪念约翰？
You'll forget what you saw, or else!
就当你什么都没看见，否则别怪我不客气！
Give me your weapon and your money and leave.
交出武器和钱，然后滚蛋。
Give me your weapon and leave.
把你的武器给我，然后快滚。
Give me everything you have and leave!
把你身上所有东西都给我，然后滚蛋！
Tell me more about the nomads.
再跟我说说那些游牧民的事吧。
I have those horseshoes for you.
我给你把马蹄铁带来了。
I've got those horseshoes for you.
我给你把马蹄铁拿来了。
I'll rest and come back later.
I'll rest and come back later.
I'll give you back your ring in exchange for some food for Mutt.
我会把戒指还你，给呆呆换点吃的。
那些羊的事情总算搞完了。
How do I know a good strike from a bad one?
我要怎么区分锤得是好是坏呢？
How do you get on with the nomads?
你们与游牧民关系如何？
How did you meet Jan Zizka?
你是怎么认识扬·杰式卡的？
Where did you meet Jan Zizka?
你是在哪认识扬·杰式卡的？
Why don't you drive out the local nomads?
你们为什么不将本地游牧民赶走呢？
Why don't you drive the nomads off?
你为什么不把那些游牧民赶走？
科兹里克是你的兄弟吗？
我是在斯卡里茨长大的。
How can I get to the nomads' encampment?
我怎么进入游牧民的营地？
告知斯卡里茨的乔汉卡的过往。
你为什么要加入杰式卡那边？
我更喜欢钉头锤（重武器）
I can manage even without a weapon. (Unarmed)
根本用不着什么武器（徒手）
你跳起舞就像个精灵。（撒谎）
Did you fall back when you were at Skalitz?
你在斯卡里茨的时候退缩了吗？
If you want a picture, I'll draw a picture.
如果你想要图画，我可以画一张图。
I saw Toth at the pond!
我在池塘边看见了托思！
这可不是什么寻常的工作！
Did you meet Father Prokop's foster daughter, Jarka?
你是否见过普罗科普神父的养女贾卡？
You'll be doing yourself a favour as well.
There was a cloak of the Knights of the Cross in the hiding-place.
在藏匿地点有一件红星十字骑士团的斗篷。
Could it have been Father Prokop?
有没有可能是普罗科普神父干的？
I'm looking for a captive nomad.
我在找一个被抓的游牧民。
I bring you absolution. (Hand over the cross)
你被宽恕了。（递上十字架）
会是普罗科普神父干的吗？
I want to report what's going on with Miller Kreyzl.
我是来汇报磨坊主克雷泽的情况的。
I helped Janosh out of a pillory.
我把亚诺什从颈手枷里弄出来了。
我能留下这把钉头锤吗？
What about the nomads by the pond?
说说在池塘边扎营的那些游牧民吧。
What do you think of the nomads?
你对那些游牧民有什么看法？
What do you think of the nomads?
你对那些游牧民有什么看法？
What do you think of the nomads?
你对那些游牧民有什么看法？
I know about mining from Skalitz.
我了解斯卡里茨的采矿业。
Where can I find the pillory?
我在哪里可以找到颈手枷？
I'm looking for Ranyek, an archer.
我在找拉涅克，一个弓箭手。
I asked about the chamberlain at the bathhouse.
Do you know how I get to the Maiden?
我发现了一个死去的牧羊人。
你为什么欺负托比亚斯？
I'm a messenger from Jan of Suchotlesky.
我是苏霍茨基的扬的信使。
I'm seeking reinforcements for Jan of Suchotlesky.
我在为苏霍茨基的扬寻求援军。
Did you hear it too, Father Marian?
你也听到了吗，神父马里安？
我是从斯卡里茨逃走的。
There's supposed to be a captured nomad here…
这里应该有个被抓起来的游牧民…
There's supposed to be a captured nomad here…
这里应该有个被抓起来的游牧民…
It's said the herdsboy saw an apparition?
据说那个牧羊人看到了幽灵？
I'm looking for a captive nomad.
我在找一个被抓的游牧民。
He's looking for a girl for the chamberlain.
他在为管家找一个姑娘。
Do you have a job for me?
(Let Hare go, but take his money)
How did you wind up with the nomads?
你们怎么会和游牧民混在一起？
我们可以谈谈斯卡里茨的事吗？
Did you kill anyone in Skalitz?
你在斯卡里茨杀过人吗？
I just couldn't do it, not after Skalitz.
我不能这么做，这和斯卡里茨的时候有什么区别？
It was Konrad, a knight of the order.
是康拉德，红星十字骑士团的一员。
你是来自斯卡里茨的亨利吗？
Lasst uns hier verschwinden! (我们快点逃出去！）
Mein Gott! Was ist da los?!
Mein Gott! Was ist da los?! （我的天啊！到底怎么了？）
Nein, das wird nicht passieren … （这下完蛋了…)
Oh, lieber Gott, nein! （哦，天啊，不！）
Oh, mein Gott, Jungs …（我的天啊，各位…)
Oh nein, nein … Blut! （哦不，不…我在流血！）
Ich werd hier nicht sterben! （我还不想死在这里！）
Scheiße, raus … raus hier! （靠，跑…快跑，逃命啊！）
Verdammt, Blut … Blut! （操，血……我在流血！）
He, du verdammter … (嘿，你这该死的…)
Oh, Gott, ich wurde …（哦，天啊，我受伤了！）
Uff, nein … ist das … Blut? （哎哟，不是吧……这是血吗？）
Verdammt, meine Finger! (该死，我的手指！）
However, the Kuttenberg brotherhood will be granted the advantage of the hauberk, because Henry here present aggrieved them with dishonourable behaviour.
不过，库滕堡兄弟会将获得穿链甲的特权，因为出现在这里的亨利以不光彩的行为冒犯了他们。
Well, apart from a couple of bane potions, which weren't exactly intended for healing anyway. This is a different matter…
嗯，还有几瓶祸根毒药，但它们反正也不是用来治病的。这是另一回事了…
That old bugger brought the catchpole and I ended up in the pillory because of you!
那个老家伙带了治安官来，你害我被套上了颈手枷。
Ależ! No w takim razie toś zacny gość, prawda? Such a distinguished visit!
Alez! No w takim razie tos zacny gosc, prawda? ( 哎呀，何等贵客！)
Pieprzyc tego skurwysyna! （去他妈那个狗娘养的！）
You'll give me a few groschen as a deposit and forge a hunting sword. Matthias is just working on one now.
你给我几个格罗申作为定金，然后锻造一把猎刀。马蒂亚斯现在正在锻造一把。
You'll give me a few groschen as a deposit and forge a hunting sword.
你给我几个格罗申作为定金，然后锻造一把猎刀。
I am Voivode of camp, but except for Aranka, there is no more of my clan here… Just nomads from other places.
我是营地的司令官，但除了阿兰卡，这里已经没有我们家族的人了…只有从别的地方过来的游牧民。
I do not know the chohanyi's name, but I know she does not like nomads!
我不知道那女人的名字，但我知道她不喜欢游牧民！
With the letter we are free people, without we are like beasts to be hunted. They can put us in pillory, drive us out of town. Anyone can do what they like to us.
有了那封通行函，我们就是自由的，没有的话，危机四伏。他们会把我们关进颈手枷，赶出镇子，任何人都可以随心所欲对待我们。
Are you trying to kill me? I'll give you a club, you swing it the same way.
你想杀了我吗？我给你一根棍棒，你可以用挥舞钉头锤的方式挥舞棍棒。
Nein, I'll give you a Schlagstock instead of a mace.
Nein（不），钉头锤就算了，我给你根Schlagstock（短棍）吧。
Four strains of welded steel, firm blade, flexible core.
四根焊接钢，坚固的刀刃，坚韧的刀芯。
Give me a mace and a shield.
给我一根钉头锤和一张盾牌。
Give me a mace and a shield.
给我一根钉头锤和一张盾牌。
Give me a mace and a shield.
给我一根钉头锤和一张盾牌。
Give me a mace with a shield.
I want a heavy mace and a shield.
我想要一根重型钉头锤和一张盾牌。
Give me a mace and a shield.
给我一根钉头锤和一张盾牌。
Give me a mace and a shield.
给我一根钉头锤和一张盾牌。
Give me a mace and a shield.
给我一根钉头锤和一张盾牌。
Give me a mace and a shield.
给我一根钉头锤和一张盾牌。
A mace will do for me.
Take a mace and shield as well.
Take a mace and shield as well.
Take a mace and shield as well.
Take a mace and shield as well.
Take a mace and shield as well.
Take a mace and shield as well.
Take a mace and shield as well.
Take a mace and shield as well.
You take a mace and shield.
You take a mace and shield.

You take a mace and shield.
I'll take a mace and a shield as well.
I'll take a mace and a shield.
I'll take a mace and a shield.
I'll take a shield as well as a proper mace.
我要张盾牌，还有趁手的钉头锤。
I'll take a mace and a shield.
I'll take a mace as well as a shield.
I'll take a mace and a shield.
A mace, I want to hit hard!
I'll take a mace as well as a shield.
I'll take a mace and a shield.
I'll give the mace a try.
I'll try a mace and a shield.
我要试试钉头锤和盾牌。
I'll try a mace and a shield.
我要试试钉头锤和盾牌。
I'll give the mace a try.

我要试试钉头锤和盾牌。

我要试试钉头锤和盾牌。

我要试试钉头锤和盾牌。
I'll give the mace a try.
I'll give the mace a go.
I'll try a mace and a shield.
我要试试钉头锤和盾牌。
I'll have a go with a mace and shield.
我要试试钉头锤和盾牌。
I'll have a go with the mace.
I'll give the mace a try.

我要试试钉头锤和盾牌。

我要试试钉头锤和盾牌。

I'll give the mace a try.
Are you trying to kill me? I'll give you a cudgel instead of a mace.
你想杀了我吗？我给你根棍子，钉头锤就别想了。
Mielott valami rossz torténik.（免得惹来麻烦。）
I'll give you a cudgel instead of a mace. It comes to the same thing.
钉头锤就算了，我给你根棍子。这两样东西差不多。
I'll give you a club instead of a mace. It's basically the same thing.
我不给你钉头锤，我要给你一根棒子。这两样东西差不多。
You'd better take a club. A mace is no good for practice.
你最好拿根棍棒，钉头锤不适合练习。
Mein Freund, I will give you a cudgel instead of a mace.
Mein Freund（我的朋友），钉头锤就算了，我给你根短棍吧。
I'll give you a cudgel instead of a mace. It comes to the same thing.
钉头锤就算了，我给你根棍子。这两样东西差不多。
That German alehouse, The Iron Eagle, that is, Zum Eisernen Adler.
那个德国酒馆，叫铁鹰，也就是Zum Eisenadler Adler。
God in heaven, grant poor Jan eternal salvation.
主啊，请赐予可怜的约翰永恒的救赎。
I know my silence was a sin. Jan did nothing wrong.
我知道我的沉默是一种罪。约翰没有做错什么。
We are Knights of the Cross with the Red Star. Good brothers in Christ.
我们是红星十字骑士团。信奉基督的修士。
Kurva（该死）! orizd oket te（你得盯紧他们）! 你这蠢货！
Ha! Good one! That boy forgot his fellow villagers the moment he set foot out of Skalitz.
哈！很好笑！这小伙一踏出斯卡里茨就忘了他的乡亲了。
But now, gather your things and join the others in the outer bailey, Kozliek.
现在，收拾一下你的东西，和其他人到外堡场集合，科兹里克。
We'd rather have Henry of Skalitz than Lord Capon with his nose in the air or that madman the Devil.
比起眼高于顶的卡蓬领主或者那个疯子酒鬼，我们更情愿跟着斯卡里茨的亨利。
Whenever there was any kind of trouble in Skalitz, the guards knew who to look for: Henry, Fritz, and Matthew.
每当斯卡里茨出现任何麻烦，卫兵们都知道该找谁，不是亨利、弗里茨就是马修。
If you don't let him go, the nomads will come and a dreadful fight will break out. It'll be your fault and nobody else's. Just yours.
如果你不放他走，游牧民就会来，你们会打得非常凶。到时候就是你的错，跟其他人无关，只跟你有关系。
Those nomads care about family ties. Do you think they won't come for him? Do you want more blood on your hands?
这些游牧民很看重家庭。你觉得他们会对他见死不救吗？你还想造成更多的伤亡吗？
I hear there's a captive nomad here from the camp by the pond.
我听说这里有个被抓起来的游牧民，他是从池塘边的营地来的。
I hear there's some captive nomad here from the camp by the pond.
我听说这里有个被抓起来的游牧民，他是从池塘边的营地来的。
I was told Stanislav the herdsboy saw the devil in the rocks...
有人告诉我，牧羊人斯坦尼斯拉夫在岩石间看到了魔鬼……
Let him go, or all the nomads from the camp will come charging here and there'll be a terrible melee!
放他走，否则那营地所有的游牧民会冲到这里来，到时候会发生一场可怕的混战！
Would you know where I could find a young nomad lad? He's supposed to be around here somewhere.
你知道一个年轻游牧民小伙在哪吗？他应该就在附近。
I don't think this will end well. Either the nomads will come for him or… Well, you wouldn't kill a defenceless man, would you?
这样下去是不会有好结果的，要么游牧民来找他，要么…嗯，你应该没法杀死一个手无寸铁的人，对吧？
Them mangy vagrants must have a lot of valuable trinkets in their camp.
他们那些脏游牧民的营地里肯定有很多金银细软。
And the chamberlain who one of you should attend to.
以及你们其中一员要去侍候管家。
A harlot like that came here recently, asking for work. She was from them nomads.
最近来了一个这样的妓女，她在找工作。她是从游牧民那儿来的。
Soon as I found out, I turned down the chamberlain's proposals.
我一听到这种事，就拒绝了管家的提议。
Calm down, girls. Don't worry, I'll never send you to the chamberlain again.
冷静点！姑娘们，别担心，我再也不会让你们去见管家了。
A harlot like that came here recently, asking for work. She was from them nomads.
最近来了一个这样的妓女，她在找工作。她是从游牧民那儿来的。
Cut the horseshit! He was asking about the chamberlain, he wants a girl for him at the wedding!
废话少说！他在问管家的事，他想在婚礼上给管家找个姑娘！
Look, we're busy! Tell him about the time the Master Chamberlain invited you to the castle!
听着，我们都很忙！跟他讲讲管家让你们去城堡的事吧！
First of all, the chamberlain ain't no murderer or brute. Not like that fucker who killed people here in the bathhouse.
首先，管家不是杀人犯或野蛮人。不像那个在澡堂里杀人的混蛋。
I'd have the girls tell you about their experiences with the chamberlain…
我会让姑娘们告诉你她们和管家的经历。
Not bad, eh? Well? Is anyone willing to go with the chamberlain?
还不错吧，怎么样？有人愿意跟管家走吗？
They'll tell you about what they've been through with the Master Chamberlain.
她们会告诉你和管家大人都经历了什么。
No girl from Zhelejov is going with the chamberlain!
哲勒约夫没有姑娘会和管家走！
Aye, but it's all for Chamberlain Ulrich.
是的，但这都是为了管家乌尔里希。
No. He wants her to turn the chamberlain's head.
不，他想让她转移管家的注意力。
Well… it's about the Master Chamberlain.
Tell me, why don't you want anything to do with the chamberlain?
告诉我，你为什么不想和管家扯上任何关系？
Get this. He's looking for a girl… for Chamberlain Ulrich himself!
听着，他在找一个姑娘……给管家乌尔里希！
I thought the Master Chamberlain might be of a different religion, and that fucking a christian girl would be a sin.
我猜管家大人可能信奉不同的宗教，和基督徒姑娘上床是罪过。
Or does the Master Chamberlain not like silk?
还是管家大人不喜欢丝绸？
Well, the Lord Chamberlain invited me to Trosky and the girls warned me, that…
管家大人邀请我去特罗斯基，姑娘们警告我说……
And that's the only reason you're still here on the Council and not in the pillory!
这就是你仍然在议会而不是被锁在颈手枷里的唯一原因！
Look out, brother, they have crossbows and a pistole there!
小心，兄弟，他们那里有弩和一把手铳！
来自Keseloko（克塞洛克）的Trencsén（特伦奇因）。
Listen Csaba, we all people here. Neighbours even, do piče. We make some deal, hej?
听着，查巴，我们大家都在这里。甚至还是老乡，do pice（去你的）。我们总可以做个交易吧？
My name is Henry, I'm from Skalitz.
我叫亨利，我来自斯卡里茨。
And what the fuck do you want here, Henry of Skalitz?! Who sent you?
你来这干什么，斯卡里茨的亨利？！谁派你来的？
What, how come?! I won the tin badges first, you know!
什么，怎么会这样？！是我先赢下了你那个锡制徽章！
Want a swig of schnapps? Or two maybe?
要喝一口烈酒吗？或者两口？
Eh... I don't know... One time I carried a lamb all the way to Aujezd for the parish priest!
呃…我不知道…有一次，我为教区牧师背着一只羊一路走到了乌杰兹德！
Noble Sir Jan of Lesztin and…
贵族莱斯廷的扬爵士和…
Die besten Produkte auf dem Markt! Gute Preise! Kommt, Leute, kommt!
Die besten Produkte auf dem Markt! Gute Preise! Kommt, Leute, kommt!（最好的商品！物美价廉，快来选购！）
Kauft ein, kauft ein! Ich schließe bald … Kommt und kauft, Leute!
Kauft ein, kauft ein! Ich schließe bald … Kommt und kauft, Leute!（马上就要打烊了，走过路过不要错过！）
Wir öffnen jetzt! Wir öffnen jetzt! Kommt und kauft!
Wir öffnen jetzt! Wir öffnen jetzt! Kommt und kauft!（开张了！开张了！快来选购！）
Hose! Colourful hose, great for church and the tavern too!
衬裤！五颜六色的衬裤，教堂酒馆都能穿！
Fruit here! Dried fruit… sweet plums!
The Kuttenbergers may fight in hauberks and steel helmets.
库滕堡人可以穿着链甲和铁盔进行决斗。
I hear you won Thrush's gold badge.
我听说你赢走了瑟鲁什的金制徽章。
If I'm going to bet a gold badge, I want something decent out of it too!
如果要我押一块金制徽章，你也得下点像样的赌注！
Don't worry. I know how things are. And between you and me, Chamberlain Ulrich is a known lecher.
没事，我知道是怎么回事。这件事我只告诉你，管家乌尔里希是个出了名的好色之徒。
Alright, but I hope when I come back empty-handed, you’ll think up something more reasonable…
好吧，但愿我空手而归时，你能提出更靠谱的要求……
Oh, aye, ending up hanged is a real stroke of luck! So where is this fellah hanging?
哦，是啊，最后能被吊死也算是走运了！那这家伙是在哪儿被吊死的？
I'm Henry. The son of a blacksmith from Skalitz.
我是亨利。来自斯卡里茨，是一个铁匠的儿子。
I'm from Jan Zizka's retinue and we have a common interest. To send Sigismund packing and put the true king back on the throne.
我是扬·杰式卡的随从，我们有一个共同的目标。把西格斯蒙德打发走，让真正的国王重新登上王位。
I'm from the retinue of Jan Zizka, who's been fighting against Sigismund in these parts.
我是扬·杰式卡的随从，他一直在这一带与西格斯蒙德对抗。
What's with the horseshoe then? I could easily forge one myself and then use it for the sword.
马蹄铁怎么了？我完全可以自己打一个，用在剑上。
You wouldn’t happen to have any work for a blacksmith, would you? You executioners work a lot with steel, don’t you?
你有没有需要铁匠做的活儿？你们这些刽子手经常和铁器打交道，对吧？
I'm not part of your group. I'm from Jan Zizka's retinue, and we'd like to join forces with your band of brigands against Sigismund.
我不是你们组织的成员。我是扬·杰式卡的随从，我们想和你们这群绿林好汉联合起来对付西格斯蒙德。
Alright then… I'm Henry. Henry of Skalitz.
好吧......我是亨利。斯卡里茨的亨利。
You said you have some more interesting work for me. What would that be?
你说还有更有意思的活派给我，是什么？
Let's get to the point, shall we? What should this new sword look like?
咱还是说正事吧？这把新剑该做成什么样子？
So, I’ll find the noose by the cemetery, the pelt and the bezoar can simply be bought or obtained from animals, and the horseshoe... I’ll be chasing ghosts for that one.
所以，墓地旁找绳索，兔皮和粪石可以直接买到或者从动物身上获得，马蹄铁的话……我得去撞撞鬼。
Do you seriously expect me to be wandering through a charred forest at midnight looking for some apparition?
你真指望我半夜去那片烧毁的森林里找一只幽灵马？
Damn it, I had six of those, but I just threw them out...
该死，我以前有六块这样的马蹄铁，全给扔了……
Or old Stanislav, the Troskowitz herdsboy.
或者老斯坦尼斯拉夫，特罗斯科维茨的牧羊人。
Ah fuck…! I heard about Skalitz.
啊，他妈的...！我听说过斯卡里茨的事。
Look… I'm Karel, sometimes people call me Arrowhead. Damned if I know why, heheh!
听着……我叫卡雷尔，有时大家叫我锋矢。我不知道为什么，哈哈！
Look. The name's Karel, folk call me Karel Arrowhead.
听着。我叫卡雷尔，大家都叫我卡雷尔·锋矢。
Sometimes I get mixed up in… let's say some confrontation. And sometimes things get a bit dicey.
有时我被卷入...... 比方说一些冲突。有时事情变得有点棘手。
And you're going to bring me one of those horseshoes, and you'll use it when forging the sword, got it?
我希望你给我带回一个马蹄铁，用在锻造新剑上，明白了吗？
I could really use a new executioner’s sword, but tell me, you’re not going to be squeamish about me, are you?
我确实需要一把新的行刑剑，但我得先问问，你不是个胆小鬼吧？
<hahaha>Aye, and we pay a lot in silver too!
…是啊，但我们付钱时也用银子！
Of course not, you just hit the hare behind the ears, or ask some tanner to sell you one.
当然不会，你只需要找准兔子耳朵后面的位置一敲，或者找皮匠买一张皮就行。
Just laugh, you twit, but you won't be laughing long! Have you seen the big burnt out forest between Old Kutna and Grund?
嘲笑我可没用，之后你就笑不出来了！你见过老库特纳和格兰德之间那片被烧毁的森林吗？
If you want this job, then yes.
想接这个活儿，你就得去。
I'd help you with the other stuff too, but considering my luck... I reckon it wouldn't be a good idea.
我也想帮你找别的东西，但考虑到我的运气……我觉得这不是好主意。
Exactly. A stone that cures poisoning and brings good luck. Sometimes you can find it in the stomachs of animals, but don't go poaching any deer, or you'll end up being my next customer!
没错，一种能解毒、带来好运的石头，有时能在动物胃里找到。但别去偷猎鹿，不然下一个被我“服务”的就是你！
What would I be saving it for?
Hare pelt is the easiest part, you can get it anywhere. Then you can use a horseshoe. That will be tricky though. But I'll explain everything to you.
野兔皮最简单，哪儿都能弄到。接下来还得找块马蹄铁，这就有点棘手了，不过我会跟你详细说的。
First is a bezoar, you could put it in the pommel. Then a horseshoe, which could be forged into a cross-guard. But that won't be easy to find!
首先是一块粪石，可以放在剑头。然后是马蹄铁，可以锻打成十字剑格。不过这东西可不好找！
They say that at night, a huge, spectral, pitch-black horse runs through there, and the clinking of its horseshoes wakes the dead!
听说夜里会有一匹巨大的幽灵马，全身漆黑，在那片森林里奔跑，马蹄声能唤醒死者！
You're a blacksmith, aren't you? Not some clumsy journeyman!
你是个铁匠吧？不是笨手笨脚的学徒！
No! I need a magical horseshoe! Straight from the hoof of a ghost horse.
那可不行！我要的是有魔力的马蹄铁！得从幽灵马的蹄子上取！
A good blade must be flexible, but not brittle. The best blades are made from welded steel.
一把好剑必须柔韧但不脆，最好的剑是由焊接钢铸造。
There were some hunting swords, bastard swords, crossbow bolts… I also fixed the trigger on young Semine's crossbow.
有些猎刀，变种剑，弩箭……我还修好了小塞米弩上的扳机。
Except it's no good to me! It's got some pictures and some scribbling, but I can't make head nor tail of it!
但是对我来说没用！里面有些图画和一些涂鸦，但我看不懂！
The more experienced the archers, the more arrows or bolts they get, and the more they wager. Simple, eh?
弓箭手越有经验，得到的箭矢或弩箭就越多，赌注也越大。很好理解，对吗？
I give arrows or bolts to the archers, and they try to hit their target to get the most points.
我给弓箭手发箭矢或弩箭，每个人都得努力击中靶子，以获得最多分数。
You get your arrows or bolts, stand on your mark and shoot at your target, aiming to get the most points.
你拿上自己的箭矢或弩箭，站在你的标记位置上，向你的靶子射击，努力获得最高分数。
Enraged, he hurled his axe back into the water and yelled: "Fuck this axe! I want a silver one!"
他在愤怒之中，将斧子丢回了水里并喊道：“去你妈的斧子！我要银斧子！”
"You're a righteous man, Matthias, and for your honesty, you may keep both axes."
马蒂亚斯，你是个正直的人，为了奖励你的诚实，这把银斧送给你了。
Gentlemen! Please forgive this interruption. I am Captain Jan Zizka of Trotznov.
诸位！打扰一下，我是特罗茨诺夫的扬·杰式卡上尉。
I believe in the Holy Spirit, the Holy Catholic Church, the communion of saints, the forgiveness of sins, the resurrection of the body, and life everlasting.
我信圣灵。我信圣而公之教会。我信圣徒相通。我信罪得赦免。我信身体复活。我信永生。
I think it's perfectly clear that your Lair here is a gunpowder magazine. You're making black powder for pistoles!
我认为明显可以看出你这里的“巢穴”是一个火药库。你在制造用于手铳的黑火药！
If I were you, I'd forget what I saw, pal. I could get pissed off, and then nobody's safe from my blade.
伙计，你最好把看到的都烂在肚子里。要是把我惹火了，我的剑可不会留活口。
A helyiek félnek toletek.（当地人怕你们。）
Did you… Did you kill anyone in Skalitz?
你…你在斯卡里茨杀过人吗？
How did you fall in with the nomads here?
你是怎么和这里的游牧民混到一起的？
Do not go back, that's all! Fenyegetés!
Szörnyu dolgokat mondanak rólatok.（他们一直说你们的坏话。）
Well? Will you tell me what you were up to in Skalitz now?
我们现在可以谈谈斯卡里茨的事了吗？嗯？
Te vagy az orult!（你才疯了！）
I am Jan of Trotznov. Also known as Zizka.
我是特罗兹诺夫的扬，也可以叫我杰式卡。
These days in the service of Jan Sokol of Lamberg and Margrave Prokop of Luxembourg.
这段时间为兰贝格的扬·索科尔和卢森堡的普罗科普侯爵效力。
Both Jan and Olda are live, but they had to flee. Henry and I helped them. It was a close shave.
扬和奥达都活了下来，不过他们也不得不逃跑，求一条生路。我和亨利帮了他们一把，好在侥幸脱险。
So take him with you when you come see me in Kiskunfélegyházban.
那等你有空去Kiskunfélegyháza（基什孔费莱吉哈佐）找我的时候就把他带上。
But you, barátok, you are always welcome! Come see me some day in Kiskunfélegyházban.
但是你，barátok（朋友），我们将永远欢迎你！你将来一定要去Kiskunfélegyháza（基什孔费莱吉哈佐）看我！
Kiskunfélegyháza（基什孔费莱吉哈佐）! 离 Szeged（赛格德）不远!
Kiskunfélegyháza（基什孔费莱吉哈佐）！离Szeged（塞格德）不远！
Megdugtad a lányt a Skalitz kocsmában?
Megdugtad a lányt a Skalitz kocsmában?（你在斯卡里茨酒馆碰到过一个姑娘吗？）
A király egy pöcs…（狗屁国王……）
Hű, de nagy disznó vagy! You should not drink that…
Hu, de nagy disznó vagy（天啊，你这头猪）！你就不应该喝那么多…
When work finish, then. Come to Kiskunfélegyháza and try our wine!
那就等你有空吧，到时候来Kiskunfélegyháza（基什孔费莱吉哈佐）尝尝我们的葡萄酒！
Minden tisztelem a tiéd! Azt hittem, az utolsót nem tudod kezelni.
Minden tiszteletem a tiéd! Azt hittem, az utolsót nem tudtad kezelni.（真行啊！还以为这最后一杯得给你干倒了呢。）
In the second round, use a shield and any one-handed weapon. Sword, axe, mace - take your pick… er, so to speak.
在第二轮中，使用盾牌和单手武器。剑、斧、钉头锤——随你挑…呃，可以这么说。
I have two brothers, Jan and Piotr. But I have not seen them in a long time. I can only pray they are both still alive.
我有两个兄弟，扬和皮奥特。但我已经很久没有见到他们了。我只能祈祷他们都还活着。
Idz sie pieprzyc, ty zasrancu...!（去你妈的，你这个贱人……）
I'm from Skalitz. I reckon I can.
我来自斯卡里茨。我想我应该可以。
Someone help me! I can't do this on my own!
谁来帮帮我！我需要搭把手！
Where have you been?! Don't you know what happened? Help!
你跑哪去了？！不知道出事了吗？来帮忙！
I'm Henry of Skalitz. I serve the Lord of Leipa.
我是斯卡里茨的亨利。我为莱佩领主效力。
He took in Henry and raised him as his own on the orders of the Lord of Skalitz, Sir Radzig Kobyla…
他之所以收留了亨利，并把他当作自己的孩子来抚养，是奉了斯卡里茨领主拉德季·科比拉爵士之命……
For a young stripling, he's been through plenty. It's not so long since his parents were killed in Skalitz.
对于一个年轻的小伙子来说，他经历了很多。他父母不久前在斯卡里茨被杀。
Hopefully that'll be enough for him to sober up. And if not, put him in the pillory for a while, Bailiff!
希望这足够让他清醒过来。如果还不行，就将他锁进颈手枷待一阵子，执行官！
After Skalitz, I didn't expect to be on the attacking side, ever.
在斯卡里茨发生那样的事之后，我没想到自己会成为进攻的一方。
After what I went through in Skalitz, I couldn't just burn down people's homes.
在斯卡里茨经历了那一切后，我做不到烧毁人们的家园。
Aye, although turning a blind eye is more your thing, Zizka.
是的，不过睁一只眼闭一只眼更像你的风格，杰式卡。
Have you forgotten, Zizka? I'm supposed to bring him home in one piece!
杰式卡，你忘了吗？我得将他安然无恙地带回家！
And that's why you killed that man by the pond.
所以你在池塘边杀了那个人。
Fight or give up! I'm getting sick of waiting!
要么干一架，要么投降！我可等不了了！
Is that what you call fighting like a man?
Are you waiting for orders from your wife? Fight!
你在等你老婆下令吗？打呀！
Are you going to get to the task or not?
What are you waiting for, you wretch?!
你还在等什么呢，可怜虫？！
What's it to be? Are you going to fight or drop dead?
选吧！是干一架，还是直接去死？
Come on! Let's see what you're made of!
You think you can scare me? Not a chance!
你以为这就能唬住我？没门！
Ha! Can't do that, can you?
Don't worry, we'll get to that, if it's not too late.
别担心，如果还来得及的话，我们会处理的。
He's right though, Zizka. He acted like an utter madman who's tired of life...
不过他说得对，杰式卡。他当时就像个活腻的疯子……
Rot in hell. Your mum's cunt is so big you could clap inside!
去你的，滚回娘胎里去吧！
Do you get your looks from your Ma or the goat that fucked her?
你是你娘带大的，还是个野种？
Then we rise with the hand cannons and blast the bastards to smithereens! From above!
然后我们拿起手铳，从上面把这些杂碎轰个粉碎！
And one for dear old Ma!
这一记为我亲爱的老妈！
You're facing a nobleman, so make an effort!
你是在和贵族过招，拿出点真本事！
One time, a hand cannon blew up in his hand. Since then, he can't hear and he can only count to eight.
有一次，一把手铳在他手里爆炸了。从那以后，他就听不见了，而且只能数到八。
That's it, fellahs! Knock down those ladders!
就这样，伙计们！推倒那些梯子！
Do píci（他妈的）！天杀的石头！
It was Konrad. An old friend of the hermit Ambrose, and a Knight of the Cross with the Red Star.
是康拉德。他是隐士安布洛斯的老朋友，也是红星十字骑士团的一员。
